**Yellow Emperor’s Inner Canon: Lost Treatise of *Suwen***
(*Alternative Titles: Lost Treatise of *Suwen*, *Suwen*’s Unorthodox Chapter*)
**Authorship & Date Unknown**—attributed in one tradition to **Song-era Liu Wenshu (刘温舒)**. Five volumes in total. Original source: *The Orthodox Daoist Canon* (**正统道藏**), *Taixuan* (太玄) section. Cross-referenced with: **Yuan-dynasty woodblock edition**, **Ming-era *Jiajing* (嘉靖) Zhao Respectful Study Hall edition** (*Huangdi Neijing Suwen*, abbreviated hereafter as the **Ming woodblock edition**).

**Table of Contents**
Volume One: *Treatise on Needling Methods, Part One*
Volume Two: *Treatise on Needling Methods, Part Two*
Volume Three: *Treatise on Needling Methods, Part Three*
Volume Four: *Treatise on Diseases, Part One*
Volume Five: *Treatise on Diseases, Part Two*

---

**Lost Treatise of *Suwen*, Volume One: *Treatise on Needling Methods, Part One***

The Yellow Emperor inquired:
*"When ascent and descent falter, and the exchange of **qi** undergoes change, violent stagnation ensues—this I already understand. But how may one preemptively rescue life, and thus avert such calamity?"*
(*"Avert"* here means "remove/ward off." How then does one remove it?*)

Qibo bowed twice, then replied:
*"Illuminating, Your Majesty’s question! Your servant has heard the Master say: Once one has mastered the **Heavenly Elements** (**天元**), one must exhaust the **Dao/Way of Needling** (**法刺**), thereby able to subdue stagnation and bolster circulation, reinforce weakness to preserve wholeness, drain excess and retain what is needed, and eliminate this suffering."*
(*The "Master" refers to **Zhongshu Yi Dai** (**仪贷季**), the venerable ancestral teacher.*)
(*"Subdue"* means to "overcome/vanquish." "Bolster" means to "support/assist." "Retain"* is here rendered as *"preserve"* to align with the context of **qi** regulation. *"Lay"* means "remove." *"This"* refers to the suffering.*)

The Emperor said:
*"I wish to hear it fully."*

Qibo said:
*"When **Wood** (**木**) cannot ascend, disaster is imminent. The **Heavenly Pillar** (**天柱**) obstructs and represses it; if **Wood** seeks to erupt in stagnation, it must await the proper time. The time for **Wood** to erupt is when **Heaven** generates the **Yin-questioning **qi** (**问气**). When that moment arrives, one may needle it preemptively. The appropriate point is the **Well** (**井**) of **Foot Jueyin** (**足厥阴**).*
(*The **Well** of **Foot Jueyin** is **Dadun** (**大敦**)—located at the tip of the big toe, above the nail like a scallion leaf, within the space of three hairs, being the origin point of **Foot Jueyin**.*)

On an ordinary day, two hours before noon (**水下一刻**), place your hand over the point and feel the pulsation of the **dynamic pulse** (**动脉**). Insert the needle to a depth of three **cun** (of the patient’s body measurement), and retain it for six breaths. If **qi** is encountered, withdraw it swiftly. Needle the left side first, then the right. Alternatively, one may also needle this point on the **Spring Equinox** (**春分**), and no such stagnation will occur.

*"When **Fire** (**火**) cannot ascend, the **Heavenly Cover** (**天蓬**) obstructs and represses it; if **Fire** seeks to erupt in stagnation, it must also await the proper time. The time for **Fire** to erupt is when **Heaven** generates the **Left-questioning **qi** (**左问气**). Its eruption occurs when the **Master Fire** (**君火**) is at the **Spring Equinox** (**春分**), and the **Associate Fire** (**相火**) is at **Xiaoman** (**小满**). Thus, one may needle it preemptively during these two times.*
(*Both **Master Fire** and **Associate Fire** share the same needling method: the **Honor** (**荣**) point of the **Heart’s Pericardial Envelope** (**心包络**).*)
(*The **Honor** point of the **Heart’s Pericardial Envelope** is **Laoguan** (**劳官**), located in the center of the palm.*)

Two hours before noon (**水下二刻**), press the point with your hand until the **dynamic pulse** (**动脉**) responds. Insert the needle to a depth of three **cun** (of the patient’s body measurement), and retain it for six breaths. If **qi** is encountered, withdraw it swiftly—needling the left side first, then the right. Another method: needle this point during the **three sweats of spring** (**春三泄汗**).

*"When **Earth** (**土**) cannot ascend, the **Heavenly Collision** (**天冲**) obstructs and represses it; if **Earth** seeks to erupt in stagnation, it must also await the proper time. The time for **Earth** to erupt is when **Heaven** generates the **Left-questioning **qi** (**左问气**). The day of its eruption is **Wei** (**维**), specifically the **Wei of Chen** (**辰维**), which often occurs during the **two questioning times** (**二问维**). Thus, one may needle it preemptively. The appropriate point is the **Yin** (**俞**) of **Foot Taiyin** (**足太阴**).*
(*The **Yin** point of **Foot Taiyin** is **Taibai** (**太白**), located in the depression below the medial malleolus on the inner side of the foot, where **Foot Taiyin** converges.*)

Three hours before noon (**水下三刻**), insert the needle to a depth of two **cun** (of the patient’s body measurement), and retain it for seven breaths. If **qi** arrives, withdraw it swiftly—needling the left side first, then the right.

chunks.original_text: 金欲升而天英窒抑之，金欲发郁，亦须待时。 金郁待时，至天作左问气之日也。 夏至之后，金欲发郁之时，在火王后作，可预刺也。 当刺手太阴之经。 手太阴之经者，经渠穴也，在两手寸江脉陷者中，手太阴之所行也。 动脉应手，於水下四刻，刺可同身寸之三分，留三呼。 气至急出针，先左后右。 水欲升而天内窒抑之，水欲发郁，亦须待时。 水郁待时，至天作左问气之时也。 发於辰维之后，火得王之时，水可作也，可以预用针刺之也。 当刺足少阴之合。 足少阴之合，阴谷穴也，在膝内辅骨之后，大筋之下，小筋之上，按之应手，屈膝而得，足少阴之所入也。 刺可同身寸之四分，留三呼。 动气应手可刺，急出之，先刺左，后刺右。

chunks.original_text: 帝曰：升之不前，可以预备，愿闻其降，可以先防。 防护者也。 岐伯曰：既明其升，必达其降也。 升降之道，皆可先治也。 亦可以升而先刺也。 木欲降而地晶窒抑之，降而不入，抑之郁发，散而可得位。 三日不降，八日降，欲降而郁先散，而然后作地问气者也。 降而郁发，暴如天间之待时也，降而不下，郁可速矣。 降之不下，急速如天郁也，便可刺之。 降可折其所胜也。 折胜其标而虚其本也，故折其胜也。 当刺手太阴之所出，刺手阳明之所入。 手太阴之所出，少商穴也，在手大指之端内侧，去爪甲如韭叶，手太阴之井也。 刺可同身寸之一分，留二呼，而急出之。 手阳明之所入，曲池穴也，在肘外辅，屈肘两骨之问陷中，手阳明之合。 刺可同身寸之一寸五分，留七呼，动气应手至而急出之。 火欲降而地玄窒抑之，降而不入，抑之郁发，散而可矣。 二日不降，七日降，欲下而郁散之，速可刺之也。 当折其所胜，可散其郁。 火郁折水，可以除之。 当刺足少阴之所出，刺足太阳之所入。 足少阴之出#2涌泉穴也，在足心陷者中，屈足卷指宛宛中，足少阴之井。 刺可同身寸之三寸#3留三呼，动气至急出之，先左后右。 足太阳之所入，委中穴，在胭中央约文中，动咏应手，足太阳之合也。 刺可同身寸之五分，留七呼，气至而急出之，先左后右。 二次同其法刺也。 土欲降而地苍室抑之，降而不下，抑之郁发，散而可入。 五日不降，十日降，欲降而郁散，而可速刺之。 当折其胜，可散其郁。 土郁折水#4，可除其苦。 当刺足厥阴之所出，刺足少阳之所入。 足厥阴之所出，大敦穴也，在足大指端，去爪甲上如韭叶，及三毛之中，足厥阴井也。 刺可同身寸之三分，留十呼，动气#5 急出之。 足少阳之所入，阳陵泉穴，在膝下同身寸之一寸，腑骨外康陷者中，是足少阳之合。 刺可同身寸之六分，留十呼，动气至急出之。 金欲降而地彤室抑之，降而不下散#6抑之郁发，散而可入。 四日不降，九日降，欲下而郁散，可速刺也。 当折其胜，可散其郁。 金郁折火，可以除之。 当刺心包胳所出，刺手少阳所入也。 心胞胳所出，中冲穴也，在中指之端，去爪甲如韭叶，是手心主之井。 刺可同身寸之一分，留二呼，动气至急出之。 手少阳之所入，天井穴也，在肘外大骨之后，肘后同身寸之一寸，两筋问陷者中，屈肘得之，手少阳合。 刺可同身寸之一寸，留十呼，动气应手至而急出之。 水欲降而地阜窒抑之，降而不下，抑之郁发，散而可入。 一日不降，六日降，欲下而郁散，先可刺之也。 当折其土，可散其郁。 折其所胜，可以散之也。 当刺足太阴之所出，刺足阳明之所入。 足太阴之所出，隐白穴也，在足大趾之端，侧去爪甲如韭叶，足太阴之井。 刺可同身寸之一分，留三呼，得气至乃出之。 足阳明之所入，三里穴，在膝下三寸，腑骨外廉两筋问，足阳明之所合，刺可同身寸之五分，留十呼，提一至而急出之。 帝日：五运之至，有前后与升降往来，有所承抑之，可得闻乎刺法？ 岐伯曰：当取其化源也。 是故太过取之，不及资之。 太过取之，次抑其郁，取其运之化源，令折郁气。 不及扶资，以扶运气，以避虚邪也。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Emperor** said: *"When **Wood** ascends but does not advance, it can be preemptively addressed. I wish to hear of its descent—how one may guard against it in advance."* (This is about **preventive measures**.) **Qibo** replied: *"Having understood its ascent, one must necessarily grasp its descent. The **Dao/Way** of ascent and descent can all be treated in advance. One can also needle it before its ascent.*

When **Wood** seeks to descend but **Earth**’s **Jing** (**晶**, crystalline) **chamber** obstructs and suppresses it, it descends without entering, and the suppression causes stagnation and eruption. When it disperses, its position can be determined. If it does not descend in three days, it will descend in eight days. When it seeks to descend but stagnation first disperses, then **Earth**’s **Wen** (**问**, questioning) **qi** may emerge. When stagnation erupts during descent, it is sudden like the **Heavenly** **qi** awaiting its time; when it descends but does not descend fully, the stagnation can be swiftly addressed. When descent is not complete, the **qi** erupts rapidly like **Heavenly** stagnation—then it can be needled.

Descending can be achieved by **folding** its **victory** (i.e., its dominant element). **Folding** its **victory** weakens its **standard** (manifestation) while emptying its **root** (source), so it weakens its **victory**. One should needle where **Hand Taiyin** emerges and where **Hand Yangming** enters.

Where **Hand Taiyin** emerges is the **Shaochang** (**少商**) point, located on the inner side of the thumb’s tip, one **cun** (of the patient’s body measurement) from the nail like the length of a **chive leaf**. It is the **well** of **Hand Taiyin**. Needling should reach one **cun**, retaining the needle for two breaths, then withdrawing swiftly.

Where **Hand Yangming** enters is the **Quchai** (**曲池**) point, located below the outer knee’s medial condyle, in the depression between the two bones when the elbow is flexed. It is the **convergence** of **Hand Yangming**. Needling should reach one and a half **cun**, retaining the needle for seven breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds.

When **Fire** seeks to descend but **Earth**’s **Xuan** (**玄**, mysterious) **chamber** obstructs and suppresses it, it descends without entering, and the suppression causes stagnation and eruption. When it disperses, it can enter. If it does not descend in two days, it will descend in seven days. When it seeks to descend but stagnation disperses, it can be needled swiftly. One should **fold** its **victory** to disperse the stagnation. **Fire**’s stagnation can be **folded** by **Water**—this can remove it.

One should needle where **Foot Shaoyin** emerges and where **Foot Taiyang** enters. Where **Foot Shaoyin** emerges is the **Yongquan** (**涌泉**) point, located in the depression at the sole’s center, where the toes curl inward when the foot is flexed. It is the **well** of **Foot Shaoyin**. Needling should reach three **cun**, retaining the needle for three breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds, first the left, then the right.

Where **Foot Taiyang** enters is the **Weizhong** (**委中**) point, located three **cun** below the knee, in the depression outside the **shinbone** (**腑骨**) between the two tendons. It is the **convergence** of **Foot Taiyang**. Needling should reach five **cun**, retaining the needle for seven breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds, first the left, then the right. Repeat this method twice.

When **Earth** seeks to descend but **Earth**’s **Cang** (**苍**, azure) **chamber** obstructs and suppresses it, it descends without entering, and the suppression causes stagnation and eruption. When it disperses, it can enter. If it does not descend in five days, it will descend in ten days. When it seeks to descend but stagnation disperses, it can be needled swiftly. One should **fold** its **victory** to disperse the stagnation. **Earth**’s stagnation can be **folded** by **Water**—this can remove its suffering.

One should needle where **Foot Jueyin** emerges and where **Foot Shaoyang** enters. Where **Foot Jueyin** emerges is the **Dadun** (**大敦**) point, located on the tip of the big toe, one **cun** from the nail like the length of a **chive leaf**, and between the three **hairs** (**三毛**). It is the **well** of **Foot Jueyin**. Needling should reach three **cun**, retaining the needle for ten breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds.

Where **Foot Shaoyang** enters is the **Yanglingquan** (**阳陵泉**) point, located one **cun** below the knee, in the depression outside the **shinbone** (**腑骨**) between the two tendons. It is the **convergence** of **Foot Shaoyang**. Needling should reach six **cun**, retaining the needle for ten breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds.

When **Metal** seeks to descend but **Earth**’s **Tong** (**彤**, vermilion) **chamber** obstructs and suppresses it, it descends without entering, and the suppression causes stagnation and eruption. When it disperses, it can enter. If it does not descend in four days, it will descend in nine days. When it seeks to descend but stagnation disperses, it can be needled swiftly. One should **fold** its **victory** to disperse the stagnation. **Metal**’s stagnation can be **folded** by **Fire**—this can remove it.

One should needle where **Heart Envelope** (**心包胳**) emerges and where **Hand Shaoyang** enters. Where **Heart Envelope** emerges is the **Zhongchong** (**中冲**) point, located on the tip of the middle finger, one **cun** from the nail like the length of a **chive leaf**. It is the **well** of **Hand Heart Envelope**. Needling should reach one **cun**, retaining the needle for two breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds.

Where **Hand Shaoyang** enters is the **Tianjing** (**天井**) point, located one **cun** behind the outer elbow bone, in the depression between the two tendons when the elbow is flexed. It is the **convergence** of **Hand Shaoyang**. Needling should reach one **cun**, retaining the needle for ten breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** responds.

When **Water** seeks to descend but **Earth**’s **Fu** (**阜**, mound) **chamber** obstructs and suppresses it, it descends without entering, and the suppression causes stagnation and eruption. When it disperses, it can enter. If it does not descend in one day, it will descend in six days. When it seeks to descend but stagnation disperses, it can be needled first. One should **fold** its **victory** (i.e., its dominant element, **Earth**) to disperse the stagnation. **Folding** its **victory** can disperse it. One should needle where **Foot Taiyin** emerges and where **Foot Yangming** enters.

Where **Foot Taiyin** emerges is the **Yinbai** (**隐白**) point, located on the tip of the big toe, one **cun** from the nail like the length of a **chive leaf**. It is the **well** of **Foot Taiyin**. Needling should reach one **cun**, retaining the needle for three breaths, then withdrawing as the **qi** is obtained.

Where **Foot Yangming** enters is the **Sanli** (**三里**) point, located three **cun** below the knee, in the depression outside the **shinbone** (**腑骨**) between the two tendons. It is the **convergence** of **Foot Yangming**. Needling should reach five **cun**, retaining the needle for ten breaths, then withdrawing swiftly as the **qi** is raised to its peak.

The **Emperor** asked: *"When the Five **Phases** (**运**) arrive, there are sequences of advance and retreat, ascent and descent, and instances where one is suppressed by another. Can I learn the method of needling based on these **transformations**?"*

**Qibo** replied: *"One should take its **source of transformation** (**化源**). Therefore, when there is **excess**, one takes from it; when there is **deficiency**, one supplements it. When there is **excess**, one takes from it first, then **folds** its stagnation, taking its **source of transformation** to **fold** the stagnant **qi**. When there is **deficiency**, one supplements and supports it, to support the **running/flowing** **qi** and to avoid **void pathogens** (**虚邪**)."*

chunks.original_text: 不及者，当资其化源，以补其所亏，令不胜。 资取之法令，出《密语》。 资取化源法方，明於《玄珠密语》第一卷中。 黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之一竟 #1劳：原作『荣』，元刻本作『营』，并误，据文义改。 #2出：依前后文例，此前疑脱『所』字。 #3寸：疑当作『分』。 #4水：依前后文例当作『木』。 #5气：依前后文例，此下疑脱『至』字。 #6散：依前后文例，此字疑衍。 黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之二 刺法论中 黄帝问日：升降之刺以知要，愿闻司天未得迁正，使司化之失其常政，即万化之机，其皆妄然，与民为病，可得先除，欲济群生，愿闻其说。 明其迁正，故可预防。 岐伯稽首再拜曰：悉乎哉问。 言其至理，圣念慈悯，欲济群生，臣乃尽陈斯道，可申洞微。 申，显也； 洞，深也； 微，妙也。 言可尽显深妙。 太阳复布，即厥阴不迁正。 即天运不和顺，四序失合，而作疫也。 不迁正，气塞於上，当写足厥阴之所流。 气舒而复塞之，故写之。 当写足厥阴之所流，行问穴也，在足大趾之间，动脉应手陷者中，足厥阴之荣。 刺可同身寸之六分，留七呼，动气至而急出之。 厥阴复布，少阴不迁正。 天失时令，即气令不正也。 不迁正，即气塞於上。 热欲化，而风乃布外也。 当刺心包胳脉之所流。 心包胳脉之所流，劳官穴也，在掌中央。 刺可同身寸之三分，留六呼，动气至而急出也。 少阴复布，太阴不迁正。 子午天数有余，丑未不得中正也。 不迁正，即气留於上。 雨欲化，而热布於天。 当刺足太阴之所流。 足太阴之所流，大都穴也，在足大趾本节后陷者中，足太阴脉之荣也。 刺可同身寸之三分，留七呼，动气至而出之。 太阴复布，少阳不迁正。 丑未天数有余，寅申未得中正。 不迁正，则气塞未通。 热欲化，而雨复布天。 当刺手少阳之所流。 手少阳之所流，液门穴也，在手小指次指问陷者中，手少阳之荣也。 刺可同身寸之二分，留三呼，动气至而急出也。 少阳复布，则阳明不迁正。 寅申天数有余，卯酉未得司天。 不迁正，则气未通上。 燥欲治天，热化复治。 当刺手太阴之所流。 手太阴之所流，鱼际穴也，在手大指本节后内侧，散脉文中，手太阴之荣也。 刺可同身寸之二分，留三呼，动气至而急出之。 阳明复布，太阳不迁正。 卯酉天数未终，辰戌未得司正。 不迁正，则复塞其气。 寒欲行天而燥复化。 当刺足少阴之所流。 足少阴之所流，然谷穴也，在足内踝前起大骨下陷中，足少阴之荣也。 刺可同身寸之三分，留三呼，动气至而出之。 帝日：迁正不前，以通其要。 愿闻不退，欲折其余，无令过失，可得明乎？ 岐伯曰：气过有余，复作布正，是名不过位也。 即名布正，再治天而不能退位。 使地气不得后化，新司天未可迁正，故复布化令如旧岁#1。 新岁司天未得中司，去岁司天仍旧治天，是故气过天令不#2常，故与民作灾之病也。 巳亥之岁，天数有余，故厥阴不退位也。 至子午之年，犹尚治天。 风行於上，木化布天。 雨湿之化不令，风化至酷作灾。 当刺足厥阴之所入。 足厥阴之所入，曲泉穴也，在膝内辅骨下，大筋上，小筋下后陷者中，屈膝而得之，足厥阴之合也。 刺可同身寸之六分，留七呼，动气至急出其针也。

When there is **deficiency**, one must **supplement** its **source of transformation** (**化源**) to **compensate** for what is lacking, ensuring that the **running/flowing qi** (**气**) does not become **overbearing** (**不胜**).

The method of **supplementing and taking** (**资取**) is outlined in *The Secret Discourse* (**《密语》**). The **procedure** for **supplementing and taking the source of transformation** (**资取化源法方**) is detailed in the first volume of *The Mysterious Pearl: Secret Discourse* (**《玄珠密语》**).

---

**The Emperor** asked: *"When the **ascending and descending** needling (**升降之刺**) is understood to grasp its **essence**, I wish to hear of the **Celestial Sovereign** (**司天**) failing to **transmit its rectitude** (**未得迁正**), causing the **Celestial Officer** (**司化**) to lose its **ordinary governance** (**失其常政**), then the **mechanism of all transformations** (**万化之机**) becomes disordered, afflicting the people with disease. May I learn how to **prevent** this and **save the masses** (**欲济群生**)?"*

**Qibo** bowed twice in respect and replied: *"Your inquiry is profound indeed! You speak of **ultimate truths** (**至理**), and your **sage’s compassion** (**圣念慈悯**) seeks to **save the masses** (**欲济群生**). I shall now **fully expound** this **Dao/Way** (**斯道**), so that its **deep and subtle mysteries** (**洞微**) may be **revealed** (**申**, *display*) and **explored** (**洞**, *profound*) to their **wondrous depths** (**微**, *subtle*)."*

---

When **Taiyang** (**太阳**) **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Jueyin** (**厥阴**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
This means the **Celestial Phase** (**天运**) is **disordered**, and the **Four Seasons** (**四序**) fail to align, resulting in **epidemics** (**疫**).

If **Jueyin** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** becomes **congested above** (**气塞於上**), and one must **drain** (**写**) the **pathway of the Foot Jueyin** (**足厥阴之所流**).
The **qi** must be **dispersed** (**气舒**) before it is **congested again** (**复塞**), hence the need to **drain** it.

The **pathway of the Foot Jueyin** (**足厥阴之所流**) is the **Rongguan** (**荣官**) point, located between the **big toe** (**大趾**) and the **second toe** (**次指**), where the **pulsating artery** (**动脉**) yields to pressure. One should needle to a depth of **six-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之六分**), retain the needle for **seven breaths** (**七呼**), and withdraw it **swiftly** as the **qi** arrives.

---

When **Jueyin** **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Shaoyin** (**少阴**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
This means the **Celestial Phase** (**天**) has **lost its proper timing** (**失时令**), and thus the **qi’s timing** (**气令**) is **disordered** (**不正**).

If **Shaoyin** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** again **congests above** (**气塞於上**).
As **heat** (**热**) seeks to **transform** (**化**), **wind** (**风**) **repeats its deployment externally** (**布外**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Heart Envelope’s Inner Arm** (**心包胳脉之所流**).

The **pathway of the Heart Envelope’s Inner Arm** (**心包胳脉之所流**) is the **Laoguan** (**劳官**) point, located at the **center of the palm** (**掌中央**).
One should needle to a depth of **three-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之三分**), retain the needle for **six breaths** (**六呼**), and withdraw it **swiftly** as the **qi** arrives.

---

When **Shaoyin** **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Taiyin** (**太阴**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
The **Celestial Phase** (**天数**) of **zi-wu** (**子午**) has **excess**, and **chou-wei** (**丑未**) cannot **achieve rectitude** (**不得中正**).

If **Taiyin** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** **lingers above** (**气留於上**).
As **rain** (**雨**) seeks to **transform** (**化**), **heat** (**热**) **repeats its deployment in the sky** (**布於天**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Foot Taiyin** (**足太阴之所流**).

The **pathway of the Foot Taiyin** (**足太阴之所流**) is the **Dadu** (**大都**) point, located behind the **root joint of the big toe** (**大趾本节**), where the **artery yields to pressure** (**陷者**), and it is the **Rong** (**荣**) of the **Foot Taiyin** (**足太阴脉**).
One should needle to a depth of **three-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之三分**), retain the needle for **seven breaths** (**七呼**), and withdraw it as the **qi** arrives.

---

When **Taiyin** **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Shaoyang** (**少阳**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
The **Celestial Phase** (**天数**) of **chou-wei** (**丑未**) has **excess**, and **yin-shen** (**寅申**) cannot **achieve rectitude** (**未得中正**).

If **Shaoyang** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** **congests and does not flow** (**气塞未通**).
As **heat** (**热**) seeks to **transform** (**化**), **rain** (**雨**) **repeats its deployment in the sky** (**复布天**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Hand Shaoyang** (**手少阳之所流**).

The **pathway of the Hand Shaoyang** (**手少阳之所流**) is the **Yemen** (**液门**) point, located between the **second and third fingers** (**小指次指**), where the **artery yields to pressure** (**陷者**), and it is the **Rong** (**荣**) of the **Hand Shaoyang** (**手少阳之荣**).
One should needle to a depth of **two-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之二分**), retain the needle for **three breaths** (**三呼**), and withdraw it **swiftly** as the **qi** arrives.

---

When **Shaoyang** **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Yangming** (**阳明**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
The **Celestial Phase** (**天数**) of **yin-shen** (**寅申**) has **excess**, and **mao-you** (**卯酉**) cannot **take charge of the Celestial Phase** (**未得司天**).

If **Yangming** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** **does not flow upward** (**气未通上**).
As **dryness** (**燥**) seeks to **govern the sky** (**治天**), **heat** (**热**) **repeats its deployment** (**复治**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Hand Taiyin** (**手太阴之所流**).

The **pathway of the Hand Taiyin** (**手太阴之所流**) is the **Yuji** (**鱼际**) point, located on the **inner side** (**内侧**) of the **base joint of the thumb** (**大指本节**), where the **dispersed pulse** (**散脉**) is marked. It is the **Rong** (**荣**) of the **Hand Taiyin** (**手太阴之荣**).
One should needle to a depth of **two-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之二分**), retain the needle for **three breaths** (**三呼**), and withdraw it **swiftly** as the **qi** arrives.

---

When **Yangming** **repeats its deployment** (**复布**), **Taiyang** (**太阳**) fails to **transmit its rectitude** (**不迁正**).
The **Celestial Phase** (**天数**) of **mao-you** (**卯酉**) has not yet **concluded**, and **chen-xu** (**辰戌**) cannot **take charge of rectitude** (**未得司正**).

If **Taiyang** does not **transmit its rectitude**, the **qi** **congests again** (**复塞其气**).
As **cold** (**寒**) seeks to **govern the sky** (**行天**), **dryness** (**燥**) **repeats its transformation** (**复化**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Foot Shaoyin** (**足少阴之所流**).

The **pathway of the Foot Shaoyin** (**足少阴之所流**) is the **Rangu** (**然谷**) point, located **anterior to the medial malleolus** (**内踝前**), beneath the **prominent bone** (**大骨**), where the **artery yields to pressure** (**陷中**), and it is the **Rong** (**荣**) of the **Foot Shaoyin** (**足少阴之荣**).
One should needle to a depth of **three-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之三分**), retain the needle for **three breaths** (**三呼**), and withdraw it as the **qi** arrives.

**The Emperor** asked: *"When **transmitting rectitude** (**迁正**) does not proceed as it should, how can one **grasp its essence** (**通其要**)? I wish to hear of **not withdrawing** (**不退**), to **fold its excess** (**折其余**), so that it does not **err** (**过失**), and may I understand this?"*

**Qibo** replied: *"When **qi** is **in excess** (**气过**), it **repeats its deployment** (**复作布正**), which is called **not exceeding its position** (**不过位**).
This is known as **repeated deployment** (**布正**), where it **governs the sky twice** (**再治天**) but cannot **withdraw from its position** (**退位**).
Thus, the **Earth’s qi** (**地气**) cannot **follow its transformation** (**后化**), and the **new Celestial Sovereign** (**新司天**) cannot **transmit its rectitude** (**迁正**). Hence, the **qi** **repeats its deployment**, resembling the **Celestial Phase** of the **previous year** (**旧岁**).

The **Celestial Phase** of the **new year** (**新岁司天**) cannot **achieve rectitude** (**未得中司**), while the **Celestial Phase** of the **previous year** (**去岁司天**) continues to **govern the sky** (**治天**). Therefore, the **qi** **exceeds the Celestial Phase’s proper order** (**气过天令不常**), and this is why it **brings disaster** (**作灾**), causing disease among the people.

In the **year of *yi-hai* (**已亥**), the **Celestial Phase** (**天数**) has **excess**, so **Jueyin** (**厥阴**) does not **withdraw from its position** (**不退位**).
By the time of the **years of *zi-wu* (**子午**)**, it still **governs the sky** (**犹尚治天**).
As **wind** (**风**) **prevails above** (**行於上**), **wood** (**木**) **repeats its deployment** (**化布天**).
The **transformation of dampness from rain** (**雨湿之化**) is not **properly ordered** (**不令**), and the **transformation of wind** (**风化**) becomes **harsh and excessive**, resulting in **disaster** (**作灾**).
One must then needle the **pathway of the Foot Jueyin’s entry** (**足厥阴之所入**).

The **pathway of the Foot Jueyin’s entry** (**足厥阴之所入**) is the **Ququan** (**曲泉**) point, located **below the medial condyle of the femur** (**膝内辅骨下**), above the **large tendon** (**大筋**), and below the **small tendon** (**小筋**), where the **artery yields to pressure** (**陷者**). It is obtained by **flexing the knee** (**屈膝**), and it is the **He** (**合**) point of the **Foot Jueyin** (**足厥阴之合**).
One should needle to a depth of **six-tenths of the body’s inch** (**身寸之六分**), retain the needle for **seven breaths** (**七呼**), and withdraw it **swiftly** as the **qi** arrives.

chunks.original_text: 子午之岁，天数有余，故少阴不退位也。 至丑未之年，犹尚治天。 热行於上，火余化布天。 燥清之亏，雨化不令，热化复行天令也。 当刺手厥阴之所入。 心包之所入，曲泽穴也，在肘内廉下陷者中，屈肘而取之，手厥阴之令#3也。 刺可同身寸之三分，留七呼，动气至而急出之。 丑未之岁，天数有余，故太阴不退位也。 至寅申之年，犹尚治天也。 湿行於上，雨化布天。 寒化亏，热化不令，湿化复布行天令。 当刺足太阴之所入。 足太阴之所入，太#4阴陵泉穴也，在内侧辅骨下陷者中，足太阴之合。 刺可同身寸之五分，留七呼，动气至而急出之也。 寅申之岁，天数有余，故少阳不退位也。 至卯酉之年，犹尚治天。 热行於上，火化布天。 燥清令亏，热化复治，布行天令。 当刺手少阳之所入。 手少阳之所入，天井穴也，在肘外大骨后，肘后上一寸，两筋问陷中，屈肘得之，手少阳之合也。 刺可同身寸之三分，动气至而急出之也。 卯酉之岁，天数有余，故阳明不退位也。 至辰戌年，犹尚治天也。 □#5行於上，燥化布天。 风化亏，而寒化不令，清化复治，布行天令。 当刺手太阴之所入。 手太阴之所入，尺泽穴也，在肘约文中动脉应手，手太阴之所合也。 刺可同身寸之三寸，留三呼，动气至而急出之。 辰戌之岁，天数有余，故太阳不退位也。 至巳亥之年，犹尚治天也。 寒行於上，凛水化布天。 热化令亏，风化不令，寒化复治，布行天令。 当刺足少阴之之所入。 足少阴之所入，阴谷穴也，在膝下内辅骨之后，大筋之下，外筋之上，按之应手，屈膝而得之，足少阴之合。 刺可同身寸之四分，动气至而出之。 故天地气逆，化成民病，以法刺之，预可平愈。 人气通乎天地也。 气交有变，前后余退可#6天元。 刺其余源，始终可平也。 黄帝问曰：刚柔二干失守其位，使天运之气皆虚乎？ 与民为病可得平乎？ 天运如虚，可以法刺，可除之也。 岐伯曰：深乎哉问。 明其奥旨，天地迭移，三年化疫，是谓根之可见，必有逃门。 是谓根究天地之灾，铃有遐危逃生之门户。 假令甲子，刚柔失守。 柔得其位，上失其刚，虽得交司，数可未至。 甲子上未终司，己卯下虽迁正，是谓柔干孤虚其下也。 刚未正之，己不得其甲，即土运反虚而木乃胜。 刚未正，柔孤而有亏。 甲不正於己也。 土运不令正失，少阴不化，是故天与皆虚，而使邪化疫者也。 时序不令，即音律非从。 司天犹布，而中运有胜至矣。 甲未临而己已至，律无音而吕有声，即黄锺大官不应夹锺少官，即应以表，己卯下位，孤主土运者也。 如此三年，变大疫也。 甚则速，首尾三年至。 详其微甚，察其浅深。 大虚而布政日久，即深也，深即甚矣。 运未正即胜至久，即深甚也，甚即深。 首尾二年至者也。 欲至而可刺，刺之。 则以明其刺法者，即是布正而未迁正者，可刺其即令之病也。 只言知者，是以三年中有大疫至，刺补其夭之之吉也，即其细详微甚，知其所至之斯，可先齐之者也。 当先补肾俞。 土疫至而肾虚者，先补之肾俞，在骨#7第十四椎下，两傍各同身寸之一寸五分。 未刺时先口街针，暖而用之，用圆利针。 临刺时咒日：五帝上真，六甲玄灵，气符至阴，百邪闭理。

chunks.original_text: 念三遍，自口中取针，先刺二分，留六呼，次入针至三分，动气至而徐徐出针，以手扪之，令受针人咽气三次，又可定神魂者。 次三日，可刺足太阴之所注。 足太阴之所注，大白穴也，在内踝核骨下陷者中，足太阴豚之所注也。 先以口衔针令温，欲下针时咒日：帝扶天形，护命成灵。 诵之三遍，乃刺三分，留七呼，动气至而急出其针也。 又有下位己卯不至，而甲子孤立者，次三年作土疠，其法补泻，一如甲子同法也。 即甲子、甲戌、甲申、甲午、甲辰、甲寅并已丑、己亥、已酉、己未、己巳、己卯，凡甲己上下失守，皆此一法而已。 其刺以毕，又不须夜行及远行，令七日洁，清诤斋戒。 所有自来肾有久病者，可以寅时面向南，冷神不乱思，闭气不息七遍，以引颈咽气顺之，如咽甚硬物，如此七遍后，饵舌下津令无数。 仙家咽气，可以深根固蒂，以子受母气也。 咽下气，令腹中呜，至脐下子气见母元气，故日返本还元也。 久饵之，令深根以养，固蒂也。 故咽气津者，此名天池之水，可久饵之，资精气血，荡涤五藏，先溉元海，一名离官之水，一名玉池，一名神水，不可唾之，但可饵之，以补精血，可益元海也。 假令丙寅，刚柔失守。 柔得其位，上失其刚也。

chunks.original_text: 虽得其交岁，而丙未迁正治天下，辛巳独治其泉，上位丙失其‘刚干，故中水运不得，运太过也，反受土胜之。 上刚干失守，下柔不可独主之。 柔干在上，犹言不及，何况柔失刚者也。 中水运非太过，不可执法而定之。 不以诸丙年作其水太过也，当推之天数，而知有亏也。 布天有余，而失守上正。 天虽主治之，此即布正之化，正司主岁，未得正位也。 天地不合，即律吕音异。 柔干至而吕有音应，刚干未迁而律管无声，即少羽吗响，而大羽口□#8也。 如此即天运失序。 虽有化，而非常化也。

chunks.original_text: 后三年变疫。 变有微甚，故有迟速，当推其天数之浅深也。 详其微甚，差有大小。 大差七分，小差五分。 每一分，一十五日。 大差速至，小差徐徐而至之也。 徐至即后三年，至甚即首三年。 推数差速，即知运迟。 当先补心俞。 心俞在背第五椎下，两傍各一寸半。 用圆利针，於日中令温暖，次以手按穴，得其气动乃咒日：太始上清，丹元守灵。 诵之三遍，先想火光於穴下，然后刺，可同身寸之一寸半，留七呼。 得气至，次进针三分。 以手弹之，令气至而下针，得动气至而徐徐出针。 次以手扪其穴，令受针人闭气三息而咽气也。 次五日，可刺肾之所入。 肾之所入，阴谷穴也，在膝内辅骨之后，大筋之下，小筋之上，按之应手，屈膝而得之。 用圆利针，令口中温暖，先以手按穴，乃咒日：大微帝君，五气及真，六辛都司，符扶黑云。 诵之一遍，刺可入同身寸之四分，得动气至而急出之。 又有下位地甲子，辛巳柔不附刚，亦名失守，即地运皆虚，后三年变水疠，即刺法皆如此矣。 即丙寅、丙子、丙戌、丙申、丙午、丙辰，辛丑、辛亥、辛酉、辛未、辛巳、辛卯，如此上下失守，皆推大小差而刺之。 其刺如毕，慎其大喜欲情於中，如不忌，即其气复散也，令静七日。 七日后神气实，而水疫不伤。 心欲实，令少思。 思即伤神。 居当澄心，而神守中，即道自降，而其气复上。 人乱想劳神，即阴中鬼王劳神，即神役苦志心乱，故夭人命，实即神和志安，心静即中也。 假令庚辰，刚柔失守。 乙得其位，上失其庚，即谓柔失其刚也。 虽得其岁，即庚未得中位也，乙得下位，□治其地。 上位庚失其刚干，故中金运不得太过，反受火胜之也。 上位失守，下位无合。 乙未在下主地，孤立也，上无刚干正之，天运虚。 乙庚金运，故非相招。 上下相招，阴阳相合也。 司天与运各得其化。 布天未退，中运胜来。 不以阳年元胜复，支干不合有。 上下相错，谓之失守。 庚不与乙相对合也。 姑洗林锺，商音不应也。 失守即同声不相应也，姑洗，上管庚辰，太商不如应； 林锺，下管乙未，少商独应矣。 如此即天运化易。
chunks.translated_text:
After three years, the epidemic shifts. Its severity varies—some mild, some extreme—so the timing differs, depending on the depth of the **Heavenly calculations** (*tiān shù* 天數). Examining its mild or extreme nature reveals discrepancies of varying degrees. A major discrepancy (*dà chā* 大差) spans seven *fèn* 分, a minor one (*xiǎo chā* 小差) five *fèn*. Each *fèn* corresponds to fifteen days. A major discrepancy arrives swiftly, while a minor one comes gradually.

A gradual arrival means the epidemic shifts after three years; an extreme arrival means it strikes in the first three years. By calculating the discrepancies and their speed, one knows the **celestial order** (*tiān yùn* 天運) is delayed. One must first **supplement the Heart Shu** (*xīn yǔ* 心俞). The **Heart Shu** is located below the fifth vertebra on the back, one and a half *cùn*寸 from either side. Use a **round, sharp needle** (*yuán lì zhēn* 圓利針), warmed in the mouth at midday. Next, press the point with the hand until the **qi** (*qì* 氣) moves, then recite the incantation three times:
*"Tàishǐ Shàngqīng* (太始上清), *Dān Yuán Shǒu Líng* (丹元守靈).
First visualize firelight at the point below, then insert the needle to a depth of one *cùn* to one and a half *cùn* of the patient’s body, retaining it for seven breaths. When the **qi** arrives, advance the needle three *fèn* 分. Tap the needle with the hand to guide the **qi** downward before insertion, then withdraw it slowly once the **qi** moves. Next, palpate the point while the patient holds their breath for three inhalations and swallows.

On the fifth day, needle the **Kidney’s entry point** (*shèn zhī suǒ rù* 腎之所入), the **Yin Valley** (*yīn gǔ* 陰谷) point, located behind the medial condyle of the femur, beneath the large tendon and above the small one. Pressing it should yield a response; it is found when the knee is flexed. Use a **round, sharp needle**, warmed in the mouth. Press the point first, then recite:
*"Dà Wēi Dìjūn* (大微帝君), *wǔ qì jí zhēn* (五氣及真), *liù xīn dōu sī* (六辛都司), *fú fú hēi yún* (符扶黑雲).
Recite once, then insert the needle to a depth of four *fèn* of the patient’s body *cùn*, withdrawing it quickly once the **qi** moves.

Additionally, for **lower positions of Earth** (*xià wèi dì jiǎzǐ* 下位地甲子), such as **Sin-Yi** (*xīn yǐ* 辛巳) where **yielding yin** (*róu* 柔) does not align with **just yang** (*gāng* 剛), it is also called **losing its proper place** (*shī gǔ* 失守). This means the **Earthly order** (*dì yùn* 地運) is entirely **empty** (*xū* 虚), and after three years, the epidemic shifts to **water pestilence** (*shuǐ lì* 水疠). The needling methods are the same.

For example, in **Geng-Chen** (*gēng chén* 庚辰), where **just yang** (*gāng* 剛) and **yielding yin** (*róu* 柔) lose their proper alignment, **Yi** (乙) holds its position, while **Geng** (庚) loses its place above—this is called **yielding yin losing its proper alignment with just yang** (*róu shī qí gāng* 柔失其剛). Though **Yi** holds the year, **Geng** does not occupy the central position, while **Yi** holds the lower position. **Earth’s governance** (*dì zhì* 地治) is thus disrupted. The upper position of **Geng** loses its **just yang** (*gāng gàn* 剛幹), so the **central metal order** (*zhōng jīn yùn* 中金運) does not overreach; instead, it suffers **fire’s victory** (*huǒ shèng* 火勝). When the upper position loses its alignment, the lower position lacks harmony. **Yi-Wei** (乙未) governs the lower position in isolation, lacking the upper **just yang**’s alignment. Thus, the **celestial order** is empty. **Yi-Geng** (乙庚) represents the **metal order** (*jīn yùn* 金運), which does not correspond to mutual attraction. When upper and lower positions attract each other, **yin** and **yang** harmonize.

The **Heavenly governance** (*sī tiān* 司天) and **Earthly order** (*yùn* 運) each attain their transformations. **Earth’s victory** (*tǔ zhèng* 布正) has not yet retreated, while the **central order** (*zhōng yùn* 中運) arrives in victory. Since the **original yang year** (*yáng nián yuán shèng* 陽年元勝) does not repeat, the **supporting stems and branches** (*zhī gàn* 支幹) lack alignment. When upper and lower positions misalign, it is called **losing its proper place** (*shī gǔ* 失守). **Geng** (庚) does not align with **Yi** (乙). The **Gu-Xi** (姑洗) and **Lin-Zhong** (林鍾) pipes fail to resonate with **Shang** (商) tones. **Losing its proper place** means the same tones do not harmonize: **Gu-Xi**, the upper pipe for **Geng-Chen** (庚辰), does not resonate with the **great Shang** (太商); **Lin-Zhong**, the lower pipe for **Yi-Wei** (乙未), resonates only with the **minor Shang** (少商).

Thus, the **transformations of the celestial order** (*tiān yùn huà* 天運化) shift.

chunks.original_text: 故四序非常也。 三年变大疫。 金疫又名杀疫。 详其天数，差有微甚。 大差七分，即气过一百五日，即甚矣。 小差五分，即气过七十五日，即微也。 微即微，三年至。 微即徐也。 甚即甚，三年至。 甚即速也。 当先补肝俞。 肝俞在背第九椎下，两傍各一寸半。 用圆利针，以口温暖，先以手按穴得动气，欲下针而咒日：气从始清，帝符六丁，左施苍城，右入黄庭。 诵之三过#9，先想青气於穴下，然后刺之三分，得气而进针，针入五分，动气至而徐徐出针，以手扪其穴，令受针人咽气。 次三日，可刺肺之所行。 肺之所行，经渠穴也，在手寸口陷中，手太阴经也。 用圆利针，於口内温令暖，先以左手按穴，乃咒日：太始上真，五符帝君，元和气合，司入其神。 诵之三遍，刺可同身寸之三分，留二呼，动气至而出其针也。 刺毕，可静神七日，慎勿大怒，怒必真气却散之。 又或在下地甲子，乙未失守者，即一。 柔干，即上庚独治之，亦名失守者，即□□孤主之，三年变疠，名日金疠。 亦名杀疠。 其至待时也，详其地数之口#10差，亦推其微甚，可知迟速尔。 速至共三年，迟即后三年，其至如金疫，刺法同前也。 诸位乙庚失守，刺法同。 即天运各异，金杀丁之灾，化民病也同，刺而却之也。 肝欲平，即勿怒。 怒即阴生，肝为肠神也，阴生即阳、夭，夜外念安其志，勿诵恶语，即阳神魂守中。 假令壬午，刚柔失守。 下得其位，上失其主，即司天布正，木运反虚也。 虽交岁而天未迁正，中运胜即地见丁酉，独主其运，故行之燥胜天未热化，是名二虚者已。 上壬未迁正，下丁独然，即虽阳年，亏及不同。 灾亦然。 三日肝自病，风化不令，运失其壬，未得其位，天如布退，可得迁正，不假复而正角。 上下失守，相招其有期。 推之天别，又及几分，天如复位，故得相招者也。 差之微甚，各有其数也。 差七分，计一百五日，即大差之期也。 差五分，即七十五日，其下者又微也。 律吕二角，失而不和，同音有日。 上律萝宾，下吕南吕，上大角不应，下少角应，故二角失而不和也。 后壬午迁正之日，即上下角同声相应。 微甚如见，三年大疫。 微即至乙酉，甚即至甲申，甚速微徐也。 当刺脾之俞。 脾之俞在背第十一椎下，两傍各一寸半，动豚应手。 用圆利针，令口中温暖而刺之，即咒日：五精智精，六甲玄灵，帝符元首，火始受真。 诵之三遍，先想黄气於穴下，然后刺之二分，得气至而次进之，又得动气次进之，二进各一分，留五呼，即徐徐出针，以手扪之，令其人不息，三遍而咽津也。 次三日，可刺肝之所出也。 肝之所出，大敦穴也，在足大趾端，去爪甲如韭叶，及三毛之中，足厥阴之井也。 用圆利针，令口中温暖而刺之，即咒日：真□至玄，大道冥然，五神各位，气缺三田。 诵之，然后可刺入同身寸之三分，留十呼，动气至而出其针。 刺毕，静神七日，勿大醉歌乐，其气复散，又勿饱食，勿食生物。 歌乐者，即脾神动而气散也。 醉即性乱，饱即食胀，故慎忌之。 食生物即伤脾气也。 欲令脾实，气无滞，饱无久坐，食无大酸，无食一切生物，宜甘宜淡。 淡入胃也，宜益府。 淡者，土之薄味也，而又次於甘者。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus, the **Four Seasons** (*sì xù* 四序) are not in harmony.

Three years bring about a **great epidemic** (*dà yì* 大疫). The **Metal Epidemic** (*jīn yì* 金疫), also called the **Killing Epidemic** (*shā yì* 杀疫), varies in severity according to its **celestial order** (*tiān shù* 天数). When the **great disparity** (*dà chà* 大差) reaches seven **fen** (分), the **qi** (*qì* 气) lingers beyond **one hundred and fifty days** (*yī bǎi wǔ rì* 一百五日), it is then at its **most severe** (*shèn* 甚). When the **small disparity** (*xiǎo chà* 小差) reaches five **fen**, the **qi** lingers beyond **seventy-five days** (*qī shí wǔ rì* 七十五日), it is then **less severe** (*wēi* 微). **Less severe** (*wēi*) means gradual, appearing over three years. **Most severe** (*shèn*) means swift, appearing within three years.

When the **celestial order** (*tiān yùn* 天运) is **losing its proper place** (*shī gǔ* 失守) in the **Gu-Xi** (姑洗) and **Lin-Zhong** (林钟) pipes, as in the case of **Yi-Wei** (乙未) and **Geng-Chen** (庚辰), the **Metal Epidemic** (*jīn yì*) arises, also named the **Killing Epidemic** (*shā yì*). Its arrival depends on the **earthly order** (*dì shù* 地数) and the **disparity** (*chà* 差) of the **celestial order**. One must also calculate its **gradual or swift** (*wēi shèn* 微甚) nature. If it arrives swiftly, it will manifest within three years; if delayed, it will appear after three years. Its coming is akin to that of the **Metal Epidemic** (*jīn yì*), and the acupuncture method is the same as before.

In all cases where **Yi** (乙) and **Geng** (庚) **lose their proper place** (*shī gǔ*), the acupuncture method remains identical. This is because, though the **transformations of the celestial order** (*tiān yùn huà* 天运化) differ, the **Metal Killing Epidemic** (*jīn shā yì* 金杀疫) and the **people’s diseases** (*mín bìng* 民病) are the same in nature. The treatment must be applied accordingly to **ward off** (*què* 却) the illness.

To **calm the Liver** (*chéng yù* 肝欲平), one must avoid **anger** (*nù* 怒). If anger arises, the **yin** (*yīn* 阴) will manifest, and since the Liver governs the **intestinal spirit** (*cháng shén* 肠神), the **yin** will disrupt the **yang** (*yáng* 陽) and **arcane spirit** (*yāo* 夭). At night, one should **soothe the mind** (*ān qì zhī yì* 安其志), avoiding recitation of **harsh words** (*è yǔ* 恶语), so that the **yang spirit** (*yáng shén* 陽神) and **arcane spirit** (*yāo* 夭) may remain in the **center** (*zhōng* 中).

For instance, in the case of **Renshen** (壬申) where **yang-yin** (*gāng róu* 剛柔) **lose their proper place** (*shī gǔ*), the lower **celestial order** (*xià* 下) aligns with its **proper place** (*wèi* 位), while the upper **celestial order** (*shàng* 上) **loses its proper place** (*shī gǔ*). Thus, the **celestial order** (*sī tiān* 司天) aligns with **orthodoxity** (*bù zhèng* 布正), while the **Wood Season** (*mù yùn* 木运) **lacks its proper support** (*fǎn xū* 反虚). Though the years intersect, the **celestial order** (*tiān* 天) has not yet **shifted to its proper place** (*yí zhèng* 迁正), the **supporting season** (*zhōng yùn* 中运) will manifest in the **earthly order** (*dì* 地) at **Ding-You** (丁酉), **solely governing** (*dú zhǔ qí yùn* 独主其运) the **season**. Thus, its **dryness** (*zào* 燥) **prevails over** (*shèng* 胜) the **celestial order** before the **heat transformation** (*rè huà* 热化) occurs; this is called the **double lack** (*èr xū* 二虚).

If the upper **celestial order** (*shàng* 上) **Renshen** (壬申) **shifts to its proper place** (*yí zhèng*), and the lower **celestial order** (*xià* 下) **Ding** (丁) **stands alone** (*dú rán* 独然), then even though it is a **yang year** (*yáng nián* 陽年), the **disparity** (*kuī* 亏) and **alignment** (*jí* 及) will differ. The **epidemic** (*zāi* 灾) will follow suit.

Within three days, the Liver will **manifest disease** (*zì bìng* 自病), and the **Wind Transformation** (*fēng huà* 风化) will not be permitted. The **season** (*yùn* 运) will **lose its proper place** (*shī* 失) with **Renshen** (壬申), and **Yi-Wei** (乙未) will not obtain its **proper place**. If the **celestial order** (*tiān* 天) **aligns with its proper place** (*fù wèi* 复位), it will **shift to its proper place** (*yí zhèng* 迁正) without delay, and the **angle** (*jiǎo* 角) will not **misalign** (*bù jiǎ* 不假).

When the upper and lower **celestial orders** **lose their proper place** (*shī gǔ*), they **reciprocally call forth** (*xiāng zhāo* 相招) in a set **period** (*qī* 期). Calculating this through **celestial divisions** (*tiān bié* 天别) and **fen** (分), if the **celestial order** (*tiān* 天) **returns to its proper place** (*fù wèi*), it will **reciprocally call forth** (*dé xiāng zhāo* 得相招). The **gradual or swift** (*wēi shèn*) nature of the **disparity** (*chà* 差) has its own **fixed numbers** (*qí shù* 其数). A **disparity** of seven **fen** means a **period** of one hundred and fifty days, the **great disparity** (*dà chà* 大差). A **disparity** of five **fen** means seventy-five days, and the **lower disparity** (*qí xià* 其下) is even more **gradual**.

The **Lü** (律) and **Lǘ** (吕) pipes, the **two angles** (*èr jiǎo* 二角), **lose their resonance** (*shī* 失) and do not harmonize. Though they share the same **tone** (*yīn* 音), their **resonance** (*yìng* 应) differs. The upper **Lü** (律) pipe, **Luobin** (萝宾), and the lower **Lǘ** (吕) pipe, **Nanlü** (南吕), do not resonate with the **great angle** (*dà jiǎo* 大角), but the **minor angle** (*shǎo jiǎo* 少角) does. Thus, the **two angles** **lose their resonance** (*shī yìng* 失应) and do not harmonize.

On the day when **Renshen** (壬申) **shifts to its proper place** (*yí zhèng*), the upper and lower **angles** (*jiǎo* 角) will **reciprocally call forth** (*xiāng yìng* 相应) in harmony. Their **gradual or swift** (*wēi shèn*) nature will be as observed, and within three years, a **great epidemic** (*dà yì* 大疫) will arise. If it is **gradual** (*wēi* 微), it will arrive at **Yǐ-You** (乙酉); if **swift** (*shèn* 甚), it will arrive at **Jiǎ-Shēn** (甲申). **Swift** means rapid, **gradual** means slow.

One should then **acupuncture the Spleen’s point** (*pí zhī yù* 脾之俞). The **Spleen’s point** (*pí zhī yù*) is located beneath the **eleventh vertebra** (*shí yī zhuī* 第十一椎) on the back, one and a half **cun** (寸) on either side, where the **dynamic response** (*dòng tún* 动豚) is felt under the hand. Using a **round and sharp needle** (*yuán lì zhēn* 圆利针), warmed in the mouth, one first **presses the point** (*àn xué* 按穴) with the left hand, then **recites the incantation** (*sòng zhòu* 诵咒):

"Great **origin** (*tài shǐ* 太始) and **true essence** (*shàng zhēn* 上真),
Five **symbols** (*wǔ fú* 五符) of the **Celestial Lord** (*dì jūn* 帝君),
**Original harmony** (*yuán hé* 元和) and **qi** (*qì*) **united** (*qì hé* 气合),
**Celestial order** (*dì fú* 帝符) **enters its divine domain** (*sī rù qí shén* 司入其神).

Reciting this three times, one **acupunctures** (*zhēn* 刺) to a depth of three **cun** (分) equal to the **body’s inch** (*tóng shēn cùn* 同身寸), retains the needle for two **breaths** (*èr hū* 二呼), and withdraws it **gradually** (*xú xú* 徐徐) once the **dynamic qi** (*dòng qì* 动气) is felt. One then **presses the point** (*fú xué* 扪穴) with the hand and instructs the patient to **swallow** (*yàn jīng* 咽津) three times.

"True **essence** (*zhēn* 真) **reaches the Mysterious** (*dá dào míng rán* 大道冥然),
The **Five Spirits** (*wǔ shén* 五神) each in their **proper place** (*gè wèi* 各位),
**Qi** (*qì*) **deficit in the Three Fields** (*qì quē sān tián* 气缺三田).

Avoid **excessive drinking** (*dà zuì* 大醉), **singing and merrymaking** (*gē lè* 歌乐), as these actions will **scatter the qi** (*sàn qì* 气散). To **strengthen the Spleen** (*shí pí* 脾实) and **ensure free flow of qi** (*qì wú zhì* 气无滞), one should avoid **prolonged sitting after meals** (*cháng zuò* 久坐), **excessively sour foods** (*dà suān* 大酸), and **all raw foods** (*yī qiè shēng wù* 一切生物). **Sweet and mild** (*gān yí* 甘宜) foods are preferred. **Mild** (*tán* 淡) foods **enter the stomach** (*rù wèi* 入胃) and are **beneficial to the Spleen** (*yí yì fǔ* 宜益府). **Mildness** (*tán* 淡) refers to the **Earth’s subtle flavor** (*tǔ zhī bó wèi* 土之薄味), which is **secondary to sweetness** (*èr cì yú gān* 而又次於甘).

**On Nurturing the Spleen and the Five Epidemics**

Do not sit idly, nor remain outdoors for long—this is how one nurtures the Spleen.

If, moreover, the **Earthly Branch** *jiǎzǐ* (甲子) lies beneath the earth, or if **Ding-Yǒu** (丁酉) loses its proper position, failing to secure the **Central Authority** (*zhōng sī* 中司), then the **qi** will not occupy its rightful place. If **Ding** (丁) does not align with **Rén** (壬) in mutual support, this is also called **losing its position** (*shī shǒu* 失守), not **harmonious virtue** (*hé dé* 合德). Thus, the yielding fails to adhere to the firm.

When the **Heavenly and Earthly Branches** *jiǎzǐ* (二甲子) do not mutually correspond above and below, **Yin and Yang** become disordered, and thus the **Central Cycle** loses its regular governance of the **Yearly Harmonies** (*suì hé* 岁合之常政). If the **Earthly Cycle** fails to align, **three years of plague** (*biàn lì* 变疠) ensue. This is called **Wood Epidemic** (*mù yì* 名木疠) or **Wind Epidemic** (*fēng lì* 风疠). When it arrives, its severity can be inferred from its subtle signs. The method of acupuncture follows that of **Wood Plague** (*mù yì* 木疫). For all cases where **Ding and Rén** lose their positions above and below, the same method is applied.

For instance, if **Wu-Shēn** (戊申) loses its firm-yielding alignment—**Wu** (戊) should harmonize with **Guǐ** (癸)—then the **Heavenly and Earthly Branches** *jiǎzǐ* (二甲子) would ideally align **Wu-Shēn** (戊申) with **Guǐ-Hài** (癸亥). If **Guǐ-Hài** (癸亥) descends to Earth, it governs the **Earthly Authority** (*dì zhèng sī* 地正司). However, **Wu-Shēn** (戊申) exceeds **Ding-Wèi** (丁未), and since **Heaven’s count** (*tiān shù* 天数) has not yet retreated but instead spreads anew, it **loses its position** (*shī shǒu*). Thus, **Wu and Guǐ** do not harmonize. Though **Wu-Guǐ** (戊癸) belong to the **Fire Cycle** (*huǒ yùn* 火运), the **Yang Year** does not become excessive. **Wu-Wèi** (戊未) governs its proper authority, while **Guǐ** (癸) governs alone below, so it is not excessive—rather, it suffers **Water’s dominance** (*shòu shuǐ shèng* 受水胜). The **Heavenly Branch** loses its firmness, and the yielding **qi** becomes ungoverned, giving rise to **pathogenic intrusion** (*xié gàn* 邪干). If **Water Cycle** loses its position above, the **Middle and Lower Cycles** suffer deficiency, so **Heaven becomes void** (*tiān xū* 天虚) while **Earth still governs**. When the **Fire Cycle** appears in the Middle, **Water** invades it, hence the term **pathogenic intrusion**. The shifts in position vary in depth, and if **Heaven’s count** (*tiān shù*) exceeds its due measure, the imbalance may be slight or great. Yet if they eventually align in mutual support, the harmony depends on the **lunar count** (*yuè shù* 月数). When they are about to harmonize, their **musical tones** (*yīn lǜ* 音律) first resonate in unison—a sign of the **Fire Cycle’s** advance. The **Heavenly and Earthly musical scales** (*èr lǜ lǘ* 上下律吕) exhaust the **Great and Lesser Overtures** (*tài shǎo èr zhēng* 太少二征), and their harmonized tones converge. Thus, when **Heaven’s Cycle** is untimely, within three years, the **Fire Epidemic** (*huǒ yì* 火疫) arrives. It may come swiftly by **Gēng-Xū** (庚戌) or gradually by **Xīn-Hài** (辛亥). One must then **acupunct the Lung’s Back-Shu point** (*fèi shù* 肺俞).

The **Lung’s Back-Shu point** (*fèi shù*) lies below the **third vertebra** (*dì sān zhuī* 第三椎), one and a half *cùn* on either side, where the pulse responds to pressure. Use a **sharp, round needle**, warmed in the mouth. First, press the point with the hand, then insert the needle to a depth of **two *fēn*** (*èr fēn* 二分). Recite the incantation three times:

*"True and False Qi contend in struggle,
Qi infuses the Original Spirit,
The Imperial Symbol returns to its root,
Positions align with their kin."*

When the **qi** is about to arrive, visualize **white radiance** (*bái xī* 白熙) beneath the point. Insert another *fēn*, then withdraw the needle slowly as the **qi** arrives, pressing the point with the hand. The ailment may then be cured immediately. After acupuncture, maintain **mental tranquility for seven days**, avoiding **excessive grief**. Grief agitates the Lung, causing the **True Qi** to disperse once more.

In all things—**joy, anger, sorrow, delight, and fear**—one must not overindulge. These five emotions can **disturb Heaven** and **scatter the Original Spirit** (*luàn zhēn shén* 乱真神). Thus, the Sage **abandons idle thoughts** and **stills the mind**, preserving the Spirit. When the Spirit governs the form, the form remains whole, ensuring **bodily ease** and **eternal Dao**.

To **strengthen the Lung** (*shí fèi* 肺实), one must **regulate the breath** (*xī qì* 息气). Avoid **heavy panting**, excessive speech, or **prolonged breathing**. Do not speak or breathe too much, nor consume **salty, cold foods** (*xián shí* 咸食) in excess. **Grief, anger, and sorrow** are especially forbidden, as they **injure the Lung’s Spirit** (*shāng fèi shén* 伤肺神).

If, moreover, the **Earthly Branch** *jiǎzǐ* (甲子) lies beneath, and **Guǐ-Hài** (癸亥) loses its position, this is when the **yielding loses its place** (*róu shī shǒu wèi* 柔失守位), and the **Heavenly Branch** loses its firmness (*shàng shī qí gāng* 上失其刚). This is also called **"Wu and Guǐ failing to harmonize in virtue"** (*wù guǐ bù xiāng hé dé* 戊癸不相合德). When the **Cycle aligns with the void Earth**, three years later, **Fire Plague** (*huǒ lì* 火疠) emerges—akin to **Fire Epidemic** (*huǒ yì*). The treatment follows the same method. For all cases involving **Wu** (戊) and **Guǐ** (癸) losing their positions above and below, the approach is identical.

Thus, when the **Earthly Cycle** is established for five years, one must discern **losing its position** and apply the **Wetness Method** (*shī fǎ* 湿法) in acupuncture. **Epidemic** (*yì*) and **Plague** (*lì*) refer to the **disorder of firm-yielding above and below**, ultimately converging into one principle.

The **acupuncture method for Epidemics** consists of **five techniques**, summarizing all cases of **positional loss**, thus unifying them under the **Five Phases**. These are the **Five Epidemics and Plagues**, arising from **Heaven and Earth’s disharmonious qi**, transforming into **Epidemics and Plagues** that gravely harm human life. Thus, understanding **Heaven’s Primordial Principle** (*tiān yuán* 天元) allows one to **transmit the acupuncture method**, thereby **saving the people**.

---
*(End of *Huángdì Nèijīng Sūwèn Yípiān* [Yellow Emperor’s Inner Canon: Lost Tracts], Volume II)*

chunks.original_text: 黄帝日：余闻五疫之至，皆相染易，无问大小，病状相似，□#1施救疗，如何可得不相移易者？ 其病相染着，如何得不相染也。 岐伯日：不相染者，正气存内，邪不可干，避其毒气，天牝从来，复得其往。 邪毒之气，在於泄汗，反下取之，其气入於中，毒气至脑中，流入诸经之中，令人染病矣。 如人嚏得，此气入鼻至脑中，欲□□#2令勿投鼻中，令嚏之即出尔，如此即不相染也。 气出於脑，即不邪干。 从鼻而入脑，欲干复出，即无相染也。 气出於脑，即室#3先想心如日。 即正气存中而神守其本，即邪疫之气不犯之。 欲将入於疫室，先想青气自肝而出，左行於束，化作林木。 如春柏之苍翠。 次想白气自肺而出，右行於西，化作戈甲。 如剑戟之明白利刃。 次想赤气自心而出，南行於上，化作焰明。 如赫赫之炎燥。 次想黑气自肾而出，北行於下，化作水。 如波浪之黑色。 次想黄气自脾而出，存於中央，化作土。 如大地之黄色。 五气护身之毕，以想头上如北斗之煌煌，然后可入於疫室。 即正气存中，而邪疫不干。 又一法：於春分之日，日未出而吐之。 用远志去心，以水煎之，饮二盏，吐之，不疫者也。 又一法：於雨水日后三浴，以药泄汗。 注汗出臭者，无疫也。 又一法：小金丹方，辰砂二两，水磨雄黄一两，叶子雌黄一两，紫金半两。 粉作末，令细之。 同入合中，外固，了地一尺筑地实，不用炉，不须药制，用火二十斤缎之也，七日终。 常令火及二十斤。 候玲七日取，次日出合子，埋药地中七日。 亦须吉地者佳也。 取出顺日研之三日，炼白沙蜜为丸，如梧桐子大。 每日望束吸日华气一口，冰水下一丸，和气咽之。 服十粒，无疫干也。 黄帝问曰：人虚即神游失守位，使鬼神外干，是致夭亡，何以全真？ 愿闻刺法。 岐伯稽首再拜曰：昭乎哉问。 谓神移失守，虽在其体，然不致死，或有邪干，故令夭寿。 邪未干而不病，邪欲干而有卒亡也。 只如厥阴失守，天以虚，人气肝虚，感天重虚，即魂游於上。 肝虚、天虚，又遇出汗於肝而三虚，散神游上位，左无英君下，即神光不聚，而白尸鬼至，令人卒亡者也。 邪干□#4大气，身□#5犹可刺之。 目中神彩有，四肢虽玲，心腹尚温，如口中无涎，舌不卵缩者，非感厥也，即名尸厥，故可救之复苏。 刺其足少阳之所过。 足少阳之所过，丘墟穴也，在足外踝下，如前陷者中，去临泣同身寸之五寸，足少阳之原也。 用毫针，於人近体暖针至温，以左手按穴，咒日：太上元君#6，常居其左，制之三魂。 诵之三遍，次呼三魂名，爽灵、胎光、幽精。 诵之三遍，次想青龙於穴下，刺之可以同身寸之三分，留三呼，可徐徐出针，亲令人按气於口中，腹中呜者可治之。 次刺肝之俞。 在背第九椎下，两傍各一寸半。 用毫针，着身温之，左手按穴，咒日：太微帝君，元英制魂，真元及本，令入青云。 又呼三魂名如前三遍，刺入同身寸之三分，留三呼； 次进二分，留三呼； 复取针至三分，留一呼，徐徐出，即气及而复活。 人病心虚，又遇君相二火司天失守，感而三虚。 又或汗出於心，即致神魂逆於上，入泥丸也。 遇火不及，黑尸鬼犯之，令人暴亡。 不出一时可救之，四肢玲，气虽闭绝，不变色，舌#7如不卵者可救。

「The Yellow Emperor asked: *"I have heard that when the Five Epidemics and Plagues arrive, they all spread easily among one another, regardless of whether the afflicted are great or small, their symptoms being alike. If one applies #1[**prophylactic measures**] to prevent transmission, how can one ensure that none are affected? When their diseases overlap and cling to one another, how can one avoid being infected?"*

Qìbó replied: *"Those who avoid infection retain their **Heavenly Vitality** (*zhèngqì* 正氣) within. The **Pathogenic Qi** cannot assail them. They evade the **Toxic Qi** (*dúqì* 毒氣), and as **Heaven’s nurturing principle** (*tiān pì* 天牝) returns, they regain their **Dao/Way** (*wǎng* 往). The **Toxic Qi** of the Epidemics lies in **excessive sweating** (*xièhàn* 泄汗). If one instead **induces downward elimination** (*fǎnxià qǔzhī* 反下取之), the Qi enters the body’s core, and the **Toxic Qi** reaches the brain, flowing into all the **Channels** (*jīng* 經), causing people to contract the disease.

For instance, when a person sneezes, this Qi enters through the nose into the brain. To prevent it from lingering in the nostrils, one should **direct the sneeze outward** (*ràng xǔn zhī jí chū* 令嚏之即出爾), thus avoiding infection. When the Qi exits the brain, the **Heavenly Vitality** remains intact, and the mind **guards its root** (*shén shǒu qí běn* 神守其本) like the sun. Then, the **Toxic Qi** of the Epidemics cannot harm them.

Before entering the **Epidemic Chamber** (*yìshì* 疫室), one must first **visualize the Liver’s Green Qi** (*qīngqì* 青氣) emerging from the liver, moving leftward to the **East** (*shù* 束), transforming into **forests and trees** (*línmù* 林木), like the **verdant cypress of spring**. Next, **visualize the Lung’s White Qi** (*báiqì* 白氣) emerging from the lungs, moving rightward to the **West** (*xī* 西), transforming into **weapons and armor** (*gējiǎ* 戈甲), like the **sharp, gleaming blades** of swords and spears. Then, **visualize the Heart’s Red Qi** (*chìqì* 赤氣) emerging from the heart, moving southward upward, transforming into **flames** (*yànmíng* 焰明), like the **intense, scorching heat** of summer. Next, **visualize the Kidney’s Black Qi** (*hēiqì* 黑氣) emerging from the kidneys, moving northward downward, transforming into **water** (*shuǐ* 水), like the **dark waves** of the sea. Finally, **visualize the Spleen’s Yellow Qi** (*huángqì* 黄氣) emerging from the spleen, residing in the center, transforming into **earth** (*tǔ* 土), like the **vast, yellow expanse** of the land. When the **Five Qi** (*wǔqì* 五氣) have fully **shielded the body** (*hùshēn* 护身), one should **visualize the brilliance of the Northern Dipper** (*běidǒu* 北斗) above the head. Only then can one safely enter the Epidemic Chamber, ensuring that the **Heavenly Vitality** remains intact and the **Pathogenic Qi** of the Epidemics cannot assail.

Another method: On the day of the **Spring Equinox** (*chūnfēn* 春分), before the sun rises, one should **expectorate** (*tǔ* 吐). Using **far-reaching farzhi** (*yuǎnzhì* 远志, *farzhi* 远志) with its heart removed, decocted in water, and consumed in two cups, then **expectorating**, one can avoid the Epidemics.

Another method: After the **Rain Water** (*yǔshuǐ* 雨水) solar term, on three consecutive days of **bathing with medicinal herbs** (*yàohàn* 药浴), one should **induce sweating** (*xièhàn* 泄汗). If the sweat is **foul-smelling** (*chòu* 臭), it indicates the Epidemics have been **expelled** (*wúyì* 无疫).

Another method: The **Minor Golden Elixir Formula** (*xiǎojīndān fāng* 小金丹方):
Two *liǎng* (两) of **Cinnabar** (*chénshā* 辰砂),
One *liǎng* (两) of **Realgar** (*xiōnghuáng* 雄黄), ground with water,
One *liǎng* (两) of **Female Realgar** (*qícǐ zhīhuáng* 雌黄, *qícǐ* 雌黄), ground with water,
Half a *liǎng* (两) of **Purple Gold** (*zǐjīn* 紫金).
Grind into fine powder (*fěn zuò mò* 粉作末), ensuring it is **refined** (*lìng xì* 令细).
Combine in a **fusion vessel** (*hé* 合), seal it externally, and **bury it one *chǐ* (尺) deep**, compacting the earth firmly around it. Do not use a furnace or require **pharmaceutical processing** (*yàozhì* 药制). Instead, **use twenty *jīn* (斤) of fire** to **melt and refine** (*duàn* 缎) it for seven days. Always maintain the fire at twenty *jīn* (斤).

On the seventh day, when the **bell-like resonance** (*líng* 玲) is heard, dig up the vessel the next day and **bury the medicine in the earth for seven days**. A **auspicious location** (*jí dì* 吉地) is preferable.

After retrieving it, **grind it in accordance with the sun’s path** (*shùnrì yán* 顺日研) for three days. Form pills with **white sand and honey** (*báishā mì* 白沙蜜), each as large as a **Chinese parasol tree seed** (*wútóngzǐ* 梧桐子). Daily, facing the **East** (*shù* 束), inhale the **Qi of the Sun’s Radiance** (*rìhuágì* 日华气) once, swallow a pill with **iced water**, and **harmonize the Qi** before gulping it down. After ingesting ten pills, the **Pathogenic Qi** will no longer assail.

The Yellow Emperor asked: *"When a person’s **Heavenly Vitality** is depleted, their **spirit** (*shén* 神) wanders and loses its position, allowing **external pathogenic influences** (*guǐshén wàigàn* 鬼神外干) to intrude, leading to premature death. How can one preserve the **True Essence** (*quánzhēn* 全真) and avoid this? I wish to hear the **acupuncture method** (*cìfǎ* 刺法)."*

Qìbó bowed twice and replied: *"Illuminating is your question! When the **spirit** (*shén* 神) drifts and loses its guard, though it remains within the body, it does not necessarily lead to death. Yet, if **Pathogenic Qi** assails it, then **lifespan is shortened** (*tiāoshòu* 夭寿). If the **Pathogenic Qi** has not yet assailed, there is no illness. But when it is about to assail, **premature death** may occur.

For example, if the **Liver’s Minor Yin** (*gèyīn* 厥阴) loses its guard, **Heaven’s nurturing principle** (*tiān pì* 天牝) becomes **vacant** (*xū* 虚), and the **human Qi** (*rénqì* 人氣) of the liver becomes **depleted** (*xū* 虚), compounding with the **Heavenly Vacancy** (*tiān xū* 天虚). The **soul** (*hún* 魂) then **wanders upward** (*yóushàng* 游於上). When the liver is **depleted** (*xū* 虚), **Heaven is vacant** (*xū* 虚), and one **sweats excessively** (*chūhàn* 出汗) in the liver region, resulting in **triple depletion** (*sān xū* 三虚), the **spirit** (*shén* 神) scatters and wanders to the upper regions. If the **Left Side’s Guardian Spirit** (*yīngjūn* 英君) does not descend, the **spiritual light** (*shén guāng* 神光) fails to gather, and the **Black Corpse Ghost** (*bái shī guǐ* 白尸鬼) invades, causing **premature death**.

If the **Pathogenic Qi** assails the **Major Qi** (*dàqì* 大氣), the body **may still be treatable** (*yǒukě cìzhī* 可刺之). When the **spiritual luster** (*shén cǎi* 神彩) remains in the eyes, though the **limbs are cold** (*sìzhī líng* 四肢玲), the **chest and abdomen are still warm** (*xīnfù shàng wēn* 心腹尚温), and the **tongue** (*shé* 舌) is **not retracted** (*bù juǎnsuō* 不卵缩), this is not **Minor Yin’s loss** (*bù gǎn gèyīn* 非感厥), and it is called **Corpse Cold** (*shī jué* 尸厥). Thus, it can be **revived** (*fǔsū* 复苏).

**Puncture the Foot Minor Yang Channel** (*zú shǎoyáng jīng* 足少阳之所过), which passes through the **Hill Mound Hole** (*qiūxū* 丘墟) located below the **external ankle** (*zúwàiì* 足外踝下), in the **concave depression** (*rú qián èn* 如前陷者中), five *cùn* (寸) from the **Tear Point** (*línqì* 临泣), the **origin of the Foot Minor Yang** (*zú shǎoyáng zhī yuán* 足少阳之原). Use a **fine needle** (*háo zhēn* 毫针), warming it near the body until it is **comfortably warm** (*jìn wēn* 暖针至温). With the left hand pressing the point, recite the incantation: *"**Supreme Primordial Lord** (*tàishàng yuánjūn* 太上元君), who **dwells perpetually on the left**, commands the **Three Souls** (*sān hún* 三魂)."* Chant three times, then call out the names of the **Three Souls** (*sān hún míng* 三魂名): **Vital Spirit** (*cuànglíng* 爽灵), **Fetal Light** (*tāiguāng* 胎光), **Mysterious Essence** (*yōujīng* 幽精). Chant three times more, then **visualize the Green Dragon** (*qīnglóng* 青龙) beneath the point. Puncture to a depth of three *fēn* (分) of the **same-body inch** (*tóngshēncùn* 同身寸), retain for three breaths, then **gradually withdraw the needle**. Press where the patient feels **Qi** (*ànqì* 按气) at the mouth, and if there is a **gurgling sound** (*wū* 呜) in the abdomen, treatment is successful.

Next, **puncture the Liver’s Back-Shu Point** (*gān zhī yù* 肝之俞), located below the **ninth vertebra** (*dì jiǔ zhuī* 第九椎下), one and a half *cùn* (寸) on either side. Use a **fine needle**, warming it until the body feels **comfortably warm**. With the left hand pressing the point, recite the incantation: *"**Lord of the Great Mystery** (*tàiwēi dìjūn* 太微帝君), **Primordial Guardian** (*yuán yīng zhìhún* 元英制魂), **True Primordial Essence** (*zhēnyuán jíběn* 真元及本) enters the **Azure Clouds** (*qīngyún* 青云)."* Again call out the **Three Souls’ names** as before, three times. Puncture to a depth of three *fēn* (分) of the **same-body inch**, retain for three breaths; then advance two *fēn* (分) more, retain for three breaths; finally, withdraw the needle to three *fēn* (分) and retain for one breath, then **gradually remove it**. The **Qi** will then **reach its target**, and the patient will **revive**.

When a person’s **Heart is depleted** (*xīn xū* 心虚), and they additionally encounter the **Heavenly Fire** (*tiān huǒ* 天火) of the **Celestial Sovereign and Minister** (*jūnxiàng* 君相) losing its guard, leading to **triple depletion** (*sān xū* 三虚). Or if one **sweats excessively** (*chūhàn* 出汗) from the heart, the **spirit and soul** (*shén hún* 神魂) will **reverse and ascend** (*nì shàng* 逆於上), entering the **Filtrum** (*níwán* 泥丸). If the **Heavenly Fire** is **insufficient**, the **Black Corpse Ghost** (*hēi shī guǐ* 黑尸鬼) will invade, causing **sudden death** (*bàowáng* 暴亡). If the condition is not yet beyond recovery, though the **limbs are cold**, the **Qi** may be **blocked and severed** (*bì jué* 闭绝), yet the **complexion does not change** (*bù biàn sè* 不变色), and the **tongue** (*shé* 舌) is **not retracted** (*bù juǎn* 不卵), then the patient can still be **saved** (*kě jiù* 可救).」

When the **divine luster** (*shén cǎi* 神彩) in the eyes remains unaltered, it can be **needled** (*kě cì* 可刺). Needle the **Hand Shao Yang** (*shǒu shào yáng* 手少阳) channel’s passage.

The **Hand Shao Yang** channel’s passage is the **Yang Pool** (*yáng chí* 阳池) point, located in the depression on the radial side of the wrist when the hand is extended. This is the **original** (*yuán* 原) of the Hand Shao Yang. Use a **hair-thin needle** (*háo zhēn* 毫针), when the patient’s body is warm, press the point with your hand, and recite the incantation three times: *"Great Unity Sovereign Lord, Filtrum Supreme Spirit—
**Dan Wu** (*dān wú* 丹无) repels the **Black Qi** (*hēi qì* 黑气), restoring its **true essence** (*zhēn* 真)."* Then visualize a **crimson phoenix** (*chì fèng* 赤凤) beneath the point, insert the needle **two fen** (*èr fēn* 二分), and retain it for **seven breaths** (*liú qī hū* 留七呼). Next, advance **one fen** (*jìn yī fēn* 进一分), and retain for **three breaths** (*liú sān hū* 留三呼). Withdraw **one fen** (*tùi* 退), retaining for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼), then slowly withdraw the needle while palpating the point—this will revive the patient.

Next, needle the **Heart Shu** (*xīn shù* 心俞), located **one and a half cun** (*yī cùn bàn* 一寸半) lateral to the **fifth vertebra** (*dì wǔ zhuī* 第五椎) on the back. Use a hair-thin needle, when the patient’s body is warm, press the point with your hand, and recite the incantation three times: *"Dan Fang guards the spirit, Five Emperors ascend to Azure—
**Yang He** (*yáng hé* 阳和) permeates the body, restoring **Huang Ting** (*huáng tíng* 黄庭)."* Insert the needle **seven fen** (*qī fēn* 七分) of the patient’s body length, and retain for **one fen** (*liú yī fēn* 留一分). Next, advance **one fen** (*jìn yī fēn* 进一分), and retain for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼). Withdraw to **two fen** (*tùi zhì èr fēn* 退至二分), retaining for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼), then slowly remove the needle while palpating the point.

When the **spleen** (*pí* 脾) is diseased, and if the **Tai Yin** (*tài yīn* 太阴) governing the heavens loses its defense, the patient will be **stricken by triple depletion** (*gǎn ér sān xū* 感而三虚). If **excessive sweating** (*chūhàn* 汗出) occurs from the spleen, leading to **triple depletion**, the **intellect and intent** (*zhì yì* 智意) spirits will wander upward, hence the term **"losing its guard"** (*shī shǒu* 失守). If the **Earth** (*tǔ* 土) is **insufficient**, the **Green Corpse Ghost** (*qīng shī guǐ* 青尸鬼) will assail the patient, causing **sudden death** (*bàowáng* 暴亡). Yet within a short time, the patient may still be **saved** (*kě jiù* 可救)—if the **limbs are cold** (*sìzhī líng* 四肢玲) but the **body and lips are warm** (*shēn wēn, chún wēn* 身温、唇温), then life may be restored.

If there is **no saliva** (*kǒu zhōng wú yián* 口中无涎) in the mouth, this is called **"corpse reversal"** (*shī jué* 尸厥). Needle the **Foot Yang Ming** (*zú yáng míng* 足阳明) channel’s passage.

The **Foot Yang Ming** channel’s passage is the **Rushing Yang** (*chōng yáng* 冲阳) point, located **three cun** (*sān cùn* 三寸) above the **Sinking Valley** (*xiàn gǔ* 陷谷) point, in the depression between the **tibial tuberosity** (*shàng gǔ* 上骨) and the **medial malleolus** (*dòng tún* 动豚) on the medial side of the leg. This is the **original** (*yuán* 原) of the Foot Yang Ming. Use a hair-thin needle, when the patient’s body is warm, press the point with your hand, and recite the incantation three times: *"Ever-present in the **Spirit Court** (*hún tíng* 魂庭), initially purifying **Tai Ning** (*tài níng* 太宁)—
**Yuan He** (*yuán hé* 元和) distributes the **qi**, reaching the **Six Jia** (*liù jiǎ* 六甲) and restoring the **true essence** (*zhēn* 真)."* Visualize **Huang Ting** (*huáng tíng* 黄庭) beneath the point, insert the needle **three fen** (*sān fēn* 三分), and retain for **three breaths** (*liú sān hū* 留三呼). Next, advance **two fen** (*jìn èr fēn* 进二分), and retain for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼). Slowly withdraw the needle while palpating the point.

Next, needle the **Lung Shu** (*fèi shù* 肺俞), located **one and a half cun** (*yī cùn bàn* 一寸半) lateral to the **third vertebra** (*dì sān zhuī* 第三椎) on the back. Use a hair-thin needle, when the patient’s body is warm, press the point with your hand, and recite the incantation three times: *"Left **Yuan Zhen** (*zuǒ yuán zhēn* 左元真) person, Six Harmonies **guest qi** (*qì bīn* 气宾)—
**Heavenly Symbol** (*tiān fú* 天符) and **Imperial Might** (*dì lì* 帝力) enter its domain."* Insert the needle **one and a half cun** (*yī cùn bàn* 一寸半), retain for **three breaths** (*liú sān hū* 留三呼). Next, advance **two fen** (*jìn èr fēn* 进二分), and retain for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼). Slowly withdraw the needle while palpating the point.

When the **kidneys** (*shèn* 肾) are diseased, and if the **Tai Yang** (*tài yáng* 太阳) governing the heavens loses its defense, the patient will be **stricken by triple depletion** (*gǎn ér sān xū* 感而三虚). If **excessive sweating** (*chūhàn* 汗出) occurs from the kidneys, leading to **triple depletion**, the **kidney spirit** (*shèn shén* 肾神) will retreat and wander at **Huang Ting** (*huáng tíng* 黄庭), though it does not leave the body, its **divine light** (*shén guāng* 神光) does not gather, hence the term **"losing its guard"** (*shī shǒu* 失守). If the **Water Cycle** (*shuǐ yùn* 水运) is **insufficient**, the **Yellow Corpse Ghost** (*huáng shī guǐ* 黄尸鬼) will assail the patient’s **right qi** (*zhèng qì* 正气), absorbing the **spirit and soul** (*shén hún* 神魂) and causing **sudden death** (*bàowáng* 暴亡). If the **qi is severed** (*qì jué* 气绝), the **limbs are cold** (*sìzhī jué líng* 四肢厥玲), the **heart and abdomen are slightly warm** (*xīn fù wēi wēn* 心腹微温), the **eye color does not change** (*yǎn sè bù yì* 眼色不易), and the **lips, mouth, and tongue do not alter** (*chún kǒu jí shé bù biàn* 唇口及舌不变), with **no saliva** (*kǒu zhōng wú yián* 口中无涎), then the patient may still be **saved** (*kě jiù* 可救).

Needle the **Foot Tai Yang** (*zú tài yáng* 足太阳) channel’s passage.

The **Foot Tai Yang** channel’s passage is the **Capital Bone** (*jīng gǔ* 京骨) point, located in the depression between the **red and white flesh** (*chì bái ròu jì* 赤白肉际) beneath the **lateral malleolus** (*wài cè dà gǔ xià* 外侧大骨下) on the outer side of the foot. This is the **original** (*yuán* 原) of the Foot Tai Yang. Use a hair-thin needle, when the patient’s body is warm, press the point with your hand, and recite the incantation three times: *"**Yuan Yang** (*yuán yáng* 元阳) nurtures the infant—
Five Elders and the **true essence** (*zhēn* 真), Filtrum’s **mysterious transformation** (*huán huà* 玄华), replenishing **jing** (*jīng* 精) for eternal preservation."* Visualize **black qi** (*hēi qì* 黑气) beneath the point, insert the needle **two and a half fen** (*èr fēn bàn* 二分半), and retain for **three breaths** (*liú sān hū* 留三呼). Next, advance to **three fen** (*jìn zhì sān fēn* 进至三分), and retain for **one breath** (*liú yī hū* 留一呼). Slowly withdraw the needle while palpating the point.

Next, needle the **Kidney Shu** (*shèn shù* 肾俞), located **one and a half cun** (*yī cùn bàn* 一寸半) lateral to the **eleventh vertebra** (*dì shíyī zhuī* 第十一椎) on the back. **Tai He** (*tài hé* 太和) and **Kun Ling** (*kūn líng* 昆灵), **true Yuan** (*zhēn yuán* 真元) held within, sustained until **Shi Qing** (*shǐ qīng* 始青)."* Insert the needle **three fen** (*sān fēn* 三分), and retain for **three breaths** (*liú sān hū* 留三呼).

chunks.original_text: 次又进五分，留三呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪之。 黄帝问日：十二藏之相使，神失位，使神彩之不圆，恐邪干犯，治之可刺，愿闻其要。 五神失守，以明刺法，又言十二神之妙用也。 岐伯稽首再拜曰：悉乎哉。 问至理，道真宗，此非圣帝，焉究斯源，是谓气神合道，契符上天。 人气动合司天，神气相合，由乎盛衰也。 心者，君主之官，神明出焉。 任治於物，故为君主之官。 故心从形，有神托心斯存，是故心者，神之舍也。 即真心失守，虚而神不守位，即妄游诸室，五神不安，而乃令虚也。 可刺手少阴之源。 手少阴之源者，即是兑骨穴也。 此是真心之源，在掌后兑骨之端陷者中，一名中都，用长针，口中温暖，刺入三分，留三呼； 进一分，留一呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪其穴，复苏也。

chunks.original_text: 肺者，相傅之官，治节出焉。 位高为君，故官为相傅。 主行荣卫，故治节由之，喘息而自然。 有多语失节，饮玲形寒悲怆？ 是以肺神不守位，即虚也。 可刺手太阴之源。 肺之源，出於大渊，在掌后大筋一寸五分问陷者中，手太阴之所过。 用长针，以口中温针，以手按穴，刺入同身寸之三分，留三呼，动气至而徐徐出针，以手扪穴。 肝者，将军之官，谋虑出焉。 勇而能断，故日将军。 潜发未萌，故日谋虑出焉。 怒而气上，遇气交不前，因而神失守，神光不聚，可用前法刺之，全神守者也。 可刺足厥阴之源。 足厥阴之源，太冲穴也，在足大趾本节后二寸陷者中，乃肝豚所过为源。 用长针，便於口中先温针，以手按穴，刺可入三分，留三呼； 进二分，留二呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪之也。

It governs the **circulation of nourishing and defensive *qi*** (*róngwèi* 荣卫), so **regulation of breathing** (*zhì jié* 治节) follows it, and **breathing** (*chuǎnxī* 喘息) occurs naturally. When there is **excessive speech and loss of regulation** (*duō yǔ shī jié* 有多语失节), or **cold, shivering, and sorrowful sighing** (*yǐn líng xíng hán bēi chàng* 饮玲形寒悲怆), it is because the **lung spirit** (*fèishén* 肺神) fails to hold its position—thus, it becomes **empty** (*jì* 虚).

chunks.original_text: 胆者，中正之官，诀断出焉。 刚正果诀，故官为中正。 直而不疑，故诀断出焉。 交动而卒怒，怒而不息，气上而不守位，使人中正不利，欲成膈噎，神光不聚，未有邪干，先可以刺治之者也。 可刺足少阳之源。 足少阳之源，丘墟穴也，在足外踝下如前陷者中，去临泣穴五寸，足少阳之所过也。 用长针，於口内温针，先以左手按穴，刺可同身寸之三分，留三呼； 进至五分，留二呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪之也。 擅中者，臣使之官，喜乐出焉。 擅中者，在胸两乳问，为气海，手厥阴包络之所居，此作相火位，故言臣使，主其喜乐，中及惊喜怒思恐，即神失守位，使人如失志，恍恍然，神光不聚，邪来干之，可用刺法治之，正神和也。 可刺心包胳所流。 劳官穴也，在手掌中央动脉，手心主之所流也。 用长针，於口中温，先以左手按穴，刺可同身寸之三分，留二呼，徐徐出针，以手扪其穴也。 脾为谏议之官，知周出焉。 心有所忆谓之意，意中出焉谓之智，智周万事，皆从意智也。 故知周出焉，意有所着#11。 欲念生他想劳意不已，智有所存，神游失守，则神元不聚，可预治之者也。 可刺脾之源。 脾之源，在足内侧核骨下陷者中，是足太阴之所过为源。 用长针，於口内温针，先以左手按穴，刺可入三分，留五呼； 进至三分，留五呼； 即可徐徐而退针，以手扪之。 胃为仓凛之官，五味出焉。 包容五谷，是谓仓凛之官。 荣#12养四傍，故云五味出焉。 饮食饱甚汗出，食饱房室，即气留滞注，神游失守，邪干未至，可以预治全真。 可刺胃之源。 胃之源#13冲阳穴也，在足咐上，如同身寸之五分，骨问动脉上，去陷谷穴五寸，是足阳明之所过。 用长针，於口中温针，先以左手按穴，刺可入三分，留三呼，进至二分，徐徐出针，以手扪其穴。 大肠者，传道之官，变化出焉。 传道，为传不洁之道； 变化，谓变化物之形。 故云传道之官，变化出焉。 男子有反之过，故失守位，邪非干之，以刺法治之，即令反却苏也。 可刺大肠之源。 大肠之源，合谷穴也，在手大指次指曲骨问，手阳明之所过也。 用长针，口中温针，刺入二分，留三分#14，进至二分，留一呼，徐徐出之也。 小肠者，受盛之官，化物出焉。 承奉胃司，受盛糟粕，受元复化，传入大肠，故云受盛之官，化物出焉。 受而有异，非合不合，神失守，可刺全真者。 可刺小肠之源。 小肠之源，腕骨穴也，在手外侧腕前起骨下陷者中，手太阳之所过也。 用长针，於口中温针，先以左手按穴，刺可入三分，留三呼； 进二分， 留一呼； 徐徐出针，次以手扪其穴也。 肾者，作强之官，仗巧出焉。 强於作用，故日作强。 造化形容，故日侠巧。 在女则当侠巧，在男正日作强。 人强作过失，动合於三元八正之日，故神失守位也，故预刺而可全真者也。 刺其肾之源。 肾之源，出於大溪，在足内踝下，跟骨之前陷者中，足少阴之所过为源。 用长针，於口中温针，先以左手按穴，刺入三分，留一呼； 进一分，留一呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪其穴也。 三焦者，决渎之官，水道出焉。 引道阴阳，开通闭塞，故官司央渎，水道出焉。 次渎者，如四渎入大海，不离其水，百川入海，只江河淮济入海，不变其道，故日四渎也。

The **gallbladder** is the organ of **central rectitude**, where decisive judgment (*juédùan*) arises. It is **unyielding and resolute in judgment**, hence its role as the organ of central rectitude. **Direct yet without doubt**, thus decisive judgment arises from it. When **emotions surge and wrath erupts**, wrath that does not cease, *qi* ascends and fails to hold its position, impairing central rectitude, risking **stagnation and choking** (*gěiyè*), with scattered *shén* light—before any evil intrusion, it may be treated with acupuncture. **Needle the source of the foot Shào Yáng**.

The **source of the foot Shào Yáng** is the **Qiūxū** (Mound Ruins) point, located at the **depression below the lateral malleolus**, five *cùn* from the **Línqì** (Tear Well) point, where the **foot Shào Yáng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the **mouth**, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn* of body-inch**, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **five *fēn***, retaining for **two breaths**; withdraw the needle slowly, palpating the point with the hand.

The **spleen** is the organ of **counsel and debate**, where **comprehensive knowledge** (*zhōuzhī*) arises. When the heart **retains memory**, it is called *yì* (intent); when *yì* manifests externally, it is called *zhì* (wisdom). Wisdom encompasses all things, arising from *yì* and *zhì*. Thus, **comprehensive knowledge arises from it**, rooted in intent. When **desire and obsession exhaust the mind**, wisdom falters, *shén* light scatters—preventive treatment is possible. **Needle the spleen’s source**.

The **spleen’s source** lies at the **depression below the medial malleolus**, where the **foot Tài Yīn meridian** passes as the source. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn***, retaining for **five breaths**; advance to **three *fēn***, retaining for **five breaths**; then withdraw the needle slowly, palpating the point with the hand.

The **stomach** is the organ of **granaries and defenses**, where the **five flavors** arise. It **encompasses the five grains**, hence its name as the organ of granaries and defenses. Nourishing the **four limbs**, thus the **five flavors arise**. When **overindulgence in food and drink** causes sweating, or when **gluttony and excess** follow, *qi* stagnates, *shén* wanders unguarded—before evil intrusion, **preventive treatment preserves wholeness**. **Needle the stomach’s source**.

The **stomach’s source** is the **Chōngyáng** (Rushing Sun) point, located **five *fēn* of body-inch above the medial malleolus**, on the **pulse between bones**, five *cùn* from the **Xiàngǔ** (Sunken Valley) point, where the **foot Yáng Míng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **two *fēn***, withdrawing the needle slowly, palpating the point with the hand.

The **large intestine** is the organ of **transmission**, where **transformation** arises. **Transmission** refers to conveying **impure pathways**; **transformation** refers to altering **physical form**. Thus, it is the organ of transmission, where transformation arises. When **men overindulge**, *shén* loses its position—before evil intrusion, acupuncture restores them. **Needle the large intestine’s source**.

The **large intestine’s source** is the **Hégǔ** (Union Valley) point, located at the **webbed junction of the index and thumb**, where the **hand Yáng Míng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, inserting to **two *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **two *fēn***, retaining for **one breath**; withdraw the needle slowly.

The **small intestine** is the organ of **reception and refinement**, where **transmutation** arises. It **receives and refines** from the stomach, accepting **waste and essence**, transmitting to the large intestine—thus, it is the organ of reception and refinement, where transmutation arises. When **reception is disrupted**, whether by excess or deficiency, *shén* loses its guard—**preventive acupuncture preserves wholeness**. **Needle the small intestine’s source**.

The **small intestine’s source** is the **Wàngǔ** (Wrist Bone) point, located at the **depression on the ulnar side of the wrist**, where the **hand Tài Yáng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **two *fēn***, retaining for **one breath**; withdraw the needle slowly, then palpate the point with the hand.

The **kidneys** are the organ of **strength and vigor**, where **clever adaptability** (*zàngqiǎo*) arises. **Strength lies in action**, hence *zuòqiáng* (action-strength). **Crafting and shaping** define *qiǎo* (clever adaptability). In women, it manifests as clever adaptability; in men, as **action-strength**. When **excessive vigor leads to error**, aligning with **critical days of the trigrams and eight directions**, *shén* loses its position—**preventive acupuncture preserves wholeness**. **Needle the kidney’s source**.

The **kidney’s source** emerges at **Dàxī** (Great Creek), located at the **depression below the medial malleolus**, anterior to the heel bone, where the **foot Shào Yīn meridian** passes as the source. chunks.original_text: 三焦次渎，即精与水道不相合也，故日三焦者，上中下。 上焦者，主内而不出，或非内而即内，故不守。 中焦者，主腐熟水谷，或情动於中，人或非动而动，是谓孤动者，神失守位。 下焦者，主出而不内，或当出而不出者，故日神失守位也。 刺三焦之源。 三焦之源，阳池穴也，在手表腕上陷者中，手少阳脉之所过也。 用长针，於口中温针，先以左手按穴，刺可入三分，留三呼； 进一分，留一呼； 徐徐出针，以手扪之也。 膀胱者，州都之官，精液藏焉，气化则能出矣。 位当孤府，故日都官。 居下内空，故藏精液。 若得气海之气，施化则波便注泄。 气海之不足，则闽隐不通，故日气化则能出矣。 人若滞便而合气注膀胱，故精泄气通#15。 水道不宣通，故神失守位。 即可以刺法全真者，方知此法大妙也。 刺膀胱之源。 膀胱之源，京骨穴也，在足外侧大骨下，赤白肉际陷者中，足太阳之所过。 用长针，於口中温针，先以左手按穴，刺可入三分，留三呼； 进二分，留三呼； 徐徐而出针，以手扪其穴也。 凡此十二官者，不得相失也。 失则灾害至，故不得相失。 失之则神光不聚，故有邪干犯之，即害天命，宜先刺以全真也。 是故刺法有全神养真之旨，亦法有修真之道，非治疾也，故要修养和神也。 神为主养之宗，故作先也。 道贵常存，补神固根，精气不散，神守不分。 内三宝，即神、气、精。 一失其位，三者皆伤。 三者同守，故日元和也。 然即神守而虽不去，亦全真。 神如去即死矣。 然虽在其体，身中而未去者，亦非守位而全真也。 人神不守，非达至真。 神不守即光明不足，故要守真而聚神光，而可以修真，真勿令泄，人为知道。 至真之要，在乎天玄。 人在母腹，先通天玄之息，是谓玄牝，名日谷神之门，一名神颠，一名上部之地户，一名人中之岳，一名胎息之门，一名通天之要。 人能忘嗜欲，定喜怒，又所动随天玄牝之息，绝其想念，如在母腹中之时，命日返天息，而归命回，入寂灭，反太初，还元胎息之道者也。 神守天息，复入本元，命日归宗。 人有诸疾守位之神，可入玄中之息，而归命之真全，神之道可久觊也。 黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之三 #1口：明刻本作『不』。
