The **Triple Burner’s secondary drainage** refers to the separation of **essence** and **waterways**, hence it is said that the Triple Burner consists of **Upper, Middle, and Lower**.

The **Upper Burner** governs what is **internal and does not exit**, or what is **not originally internal yet becomes internal**—thus, it does not hold fast. The **Middle Burner** governs the **rotting and ripening of food and drink**, or when **emotions stir within**—sometimes a person is **not moved yet is moved**—this is called **lone movement**, where the **spirit loses its station**. The **Lower Burner** governs what **exits yet does not return**—or when it **should exit but does not**—thus, it is said that the **spirit loses its station**.

**Needling the source of the Triple Burner**:
The source of the Triple Burner is the **Yang Pool** point, located on the **dorsal side of the wrist**, in the depression above the styloid process, where the **Hand Shào Yáng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **one *fēn***, retaining for **one breath**; withdraw the needle slowly, palpating the point with the hand.

The **Bladder** is the **state-capital organ**, where **essence and fluids** are stored. When **qi transforms**, they can be expelled. It occupies the **lower inner void**, hence it stores **essence and fluids**. If it receives **Qi Sea qi**, transformation occurs, and **urine and feces are discharged**. When the **Qi Sea is deficient**, **urination and defecation are obstructed**, hence it is said: *"When qi transforms, they can be expelled."*

If **stool is retained** while **qi flows into the Bladder**, then **essence leaks and qi disperses**. When **waterways are not unblocked**, the **spirit loses its station**. Thus, through **complete authenticity acupuncture**, one may truly grasp this method’s profound efficacy.

**Needling the source of the Bladder**:
The source of the Bladder is the **Capital Bone** point, located on the **lateral side of the foot**, below the **fifth metatarsal bone**, in the depression between the **red and white flesh**, where the **Foot Tài Yáng meridian** passes. Use a **long needle**, warm it in the mouth, first pressing the point with the **left hand**, inserting to **three *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; advance to **two *fēn***, retaining for **three breaths**; withdraw the needle slowly, palpating the point with the hand.

**All twelve organs** must not lose their harmony. If they do, **calamity follows**—thus, they must not lose their harmony. When they lose their station, **spiritual radiance does not gather**, and **evil intrusions** may harm **Heaven’s mandate**, making **preventive needling for complete authenticity** essential.

Thus, **acupuncture methods embody the principle of nurturing the spirit and preserving authenticity**, not merely treating illness, but rather **cultivating harmony and spiritual refinement**. The **spirit is the sovereign of nurturing**, hence it is emphasized first.

The **Dao values enduring presence**—**fortifying the spirit and securing the roots**, preventing **essence and qi from scattering**, ensuring the **spirit’s station remains unbroken**. The **Three Treasures within** are **spirit, qi, and essence**. If one loses its place, all three are injured. When all three are harmoniously preserved, it is called **Primordial Harmony**.

Yet even if the spirit remains within the body but does not firmly hold its station, it is **not true preservation of authenticity**. If the spirit departs, **death follows**. Though it may linger within the body without departing, it is still **not true preservation of authenticity**.

When a person’s **spirit does not hold its station**, they have **not attained true authenticity**. If the spirit does not hold its station, **luminosity is insufficient**—thus, one must **preserve authenticity and gather spiritual radiance** to cultivate the **true**, ensuring it **does not disperse**, for this is the **Dao of humanity**.

The **essence of true authenticity** lies in **Heaven’s Primordial Breath**. While in the **mother’s womb**, one first communicates with **Heaven’s Primordial Breath**—this is called the **Primordial Darkness**, named the **Gate of the Grain Spirit**, or the **Spirit’s Vertex**, or the **Upper Realm’s Earthly Gate**, or the **Central Peak of Humanity**, or the **Gate of Fetal Breath**, or the **Key to Heavenly Passage**.

If one **forgets desires**, **settles emotions**, and **moves in accordance with Heaven’s Primordial Breath**, severing all thoughts—**as if still within the mother’s womb**—this is called **Returning to Heaven’s Breath**, **reverting to the Original Command**, entering **Levity and Extinction**, returning to **Primordial Simplicity**, and restoring the **Dao of Fetal Breath**.

When the **spirit aligns with Heaven’s Breath** and **reenters the Original Source**, it is called **Returning to the Ancestral Root**. If a person’s **illnesses are treated by a spirit that holds its station**, they may enter **Primordial Breath** and **preserve the complete authenticity of the Original Command**, making the **Dao of the spirit enduring**.

chunks.original_text: #2□口：元刻本作『嚏也』。 #3室：明刻本无。 #4□：明刻本作『厥』。 #5□：明刻本作『温』。 #6君：此下疑有脱文。 #7舌：此下元刻本有一字空格。 #8分：疑为『呼』之讹。 #9过：明刻本作『遇』。 #10二：元刻本作『一』 #11着：元刻本作『着』。 #12荣：原作『劳』据文义改。 #13源：原作『阳』，据元刻本改。 #14分； 疑当作一呼』。 #15通：元刻本作『动』。 黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之四 本病论上 黄帝问日二天元九窒，余已知之，愿闻气交，何名失守？ 六气升降，上下交位，以五藏配天地之常。 岐伯曰：谓其上下升降，迁正退位，各有经论，上下各有不前，故名失守也。 《天元玉册》云：六气常有三气在天，三气在地也。 即一气升天，作左问气； 一气入地，作右问气； 一气迁正，作司天； 一气迁正，作在泉； 一气退位，作天左问气； 一气退位，作地右间气。 气交有合，常得位所在至当时，即天地交乃变而方泰也，天地不交乃作病也。 是故气交失易位，气交乃变，变易非常，即四时失序，万化不安，变民病也。 於是六气有升不得其升者，欲降而不得其降者，有当迁正而不得迁正者，自当其位而不得位，故有如此之分，则天地失其常政，故万民不安也。 帝曰：升降不前，愿闻其故，气交有变，何以明知？ 再问穷源用也。 岐伯日：昭乎问哉，明乎道矣。 气交有变，是谓天地机。 本#1欲升，上见天柱窒； 二火歌升，上见天蓬窒； 土欲升，上见天冲窒； 金欲升，上见天英窒； 水欲升，上见天内窒，是故天窒所胜，而不前者。 但欲降而不得降者，地窒刑之。 木欲降，而地矗窒刑之； 火欲降，而地玄窒刑之，土欲降，而地苍窒刑之； 金欲降，而地彤窒刑之； 水欲降，而地阜窒刑之； 地九窒，法天之象，本胜之气，故不降也。 又有五运太过，而先天而至者，即交不前。 运逢阳年於有司之至也，至后交胜而不过。 但欲升而不得其升，中运抑之。 木欲升而中见金运胜之，二火欲升而中见水运胜之，土欲升而中见木运胜之，金欲升而中见火运胜之，水欲升而中见土运胜之者，皆遇运太过，早至其中而先於气交，而抑之不前者也。 但欲降而不得其降，中运抑之。 然五运逢太过而先至其中，故降而不下，中运刑之，抑之不前也。 於是有升之不前，降之不下者； 有降之不下，升而至天者； 有升降俱不前，作如此之分别，即气交之变，变之有异，常各各不同，灾有微甚者也。 是故上下，天地之升降，交气有天窒、地窒之胜克，中运抑伏浅深，是故民病微甚异尔也。 帝日：愿闻气交遇会胜抑之由，变成民病，轻重何如？ 欲明其变病本源之证也。 岐伯曰：胜相会，抑伏使然。 六气升降，乃经论之道也，气交之常也，遇会之不常，而相投之，胜伏抑之成郁者也。 是故辰戊之岁，木气升之，主逢天柱，胜而不前。 辰戌之岁，太阳迁正作司天也。 即厥阴作地而作右问，至此岁而升天作左间也。 又遇司天，深计算位至天柱窒也。 木欲升，天柱金司天，土胜之不前也。 又遇庚戌，金运先天，中运胜之，忽然不前。 庚年金运先天，至次后十三日始交，司天欲升而金运抑之也。 木运升天，金乃抑之。

**From the *Yellow Emperor’s Inner Classic, Plain Questions, Lost Manuscript Scroll Four*
*Treatise on Diseases, Part One***

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"The Nine Celestial Obstructions of the Heavenly Elements—I already understand them. I wish to hear of **qi exchange**: what does it mean when **virtue/power** is lost?"*

The six **qi** ascend and descend, exchanging positions above and below, corresponding to the five **zàng** organs with Heaven and Earth’s constants.

Qī Bó replied:
*"When they ascend or descend improperly, shift from their proper positions, or retreat from their stations—each has its own principles. If they fail to advance upward or downward as they should, this is called **losing one’s station**."*

The *Celestial Element Jade Register* states:
*"The six **qi** always have three in Heaven and three on Earth. One **qi** ascends to Heaven as the **Left Intercalary Qi**; one enters Earth as the **Right Intercalary Qi**; one shifts to its proper position as **Celestial Sovereign**; one shifts to its proper position as **Earthly Spring**; one retreats from its position as **Left Celestial Intercalary Qi**; one retreats from its position as **Right Earthly Intercalary Qi**."*

When **qi exchange** harmonizes, the **qi** naturally occupy their proper positions at the appointed time—this is when Heaven and Earth interact, and all things flourish. When Heaven and Earth fail to exchange, **disease** arises.

Thus, when **qi exchange** shifts from its proper position, the **qi** transform abnormally. If this transformation is irregular, the four seasons lose their order, and all transformations become unstable—**disease** ensues among the people.

Therefore, among the six **qi**, some fail to ascend when they should, some fail to descend when they should, some fail to shift to their proper positions when they should, and some fail to occupy their proper stations when they should. Such deviations mean Heaven and Earth lose their natural governance, and the people become restless.

The Emperor said:
*"When ascent and descent fail to proceed—how does this occur? How can one discern the variations in **qi exchange**?"*

He asked again about tracing the **source** of these changes.

Qī Bó replied:
*"Your inquiry is clear, and your understanding profound. When **qi exchange** varies, this is the **mechanism of Heaven and Earth**.*

*When **Wood** seeks to ascend, it encounters the **Celestial Pillar Obstruction** and does not advance. When **Fire** seeks to ascend, it encounters the **Celestial Puff Obstruction** and does not advance. When **Earth** seeks to ascend, it encounters the **Celestial Surge Obstruction** and does not advance. When **Metal** seeks to ascend, it encounters the **Celestial Brilliance Obstruction** and does not advance. When **Water** seeks to ascend, it encounters the **Celestial Inner Obstruction** and does not advance. Thus, the **Celestial Obstructions** overcome them, and they do not advance.*

*But when **qi** seek to descend and fail to do so, the **Earthly Obstructions** restrain them. **Wood** seeks to descend, but the **Earthly Barrier Obstruction** restrains it; **Fire** seeks to descend, but the **Earthly Dark Obstruction** restrains it; **Earth** seeks to descend, but the **Earthly Azure Obstruction** restrains it; **Metal** seeks to descend, but the **Earthly Vermilion Obstruction** restrains it; **Water** seeks to descend, but the **Earthly Mound Obstruction** restrains it. The nine **Earthly Obstructions** mirror the symbols of Heaven, and the **virtue/power** of the overcoming **qi** prevents descent.*

*Additionally, when the five **phases** exceed their limits and arrive prematurely, **qi exchange** fails to advance. When a **Yang** year encounters its appointed time, after its arrival, the overcoming **qi** does not exceed its bounds.*

*But when **qi** seek to ascend and fail, the intervening **phase** suppresses them. **Wood** seeks to ascend but encounters an excessive **Metal phase** in the intervening cycle; **Fire** seeks to ascend but encounters an excessive **Water phase**; **Earth** seeks to ascend but encounters an excessive **Wood phase**; **Metal** seeks to ascend but encounters an excessive **Fire phase**; **Water** seeks to ascend but encounters an excessive **Earth phase**. All these cases involve the **phase** exceeding its limits, arriving early in the cycle, and preempting **qi exchange**, thus suppressing ascent.*

*But when **qi** seek to descend and fail, the intervening **phase** suppresses them. When the five **phases** exceed their limits and arrive prematurely, descent is hindered, and the intervening **phase** restrains them, preventing progress.*

*Thus, there are cases where ascent fails, descent fails, descent fails while ascent reaches Heaven, or both ascent and descent fail—each variation differs, and the resulting calamities range from mild to severe.*

*Therefore, the ascent and descent of Heaven and Earth, the overcoming and restraint of **Celestial Obstructions** and **Earthly Obstructions**, and the shallow or deep suppression by the intervening **phase**—these determine why the people’s **diseases** vary in severity.*

The Emperor said:
*"I wish to understand how the encounters, overcoming, and suppression of **qi exchange** manifest in **disease**, and how their severity differs. I seek to clarify the origins of these disease transformations."*

Qī Bó replied:
*"Overcoming and suppression through encounters produce these effects. The six **qi** ascending and descending follow the established principles of **qi exchange**, which is their constant state. However, when irregular encounters occur and they converge, overcoming and suppression create stagnation.*

*Thus, in years of the *Chén* branch (戊), the **Wood qi** ascends, encountering the **Celestial Pillar**, overcoming it and failing to advance. In years of the *Chén-Xū* combination (辰戌), the **Greater Yang** shifts to its proper position as **Celestial Sovereign**. The **Jué-Yin** acts as **Earthly Spring**, and by this year, it ascends to Heaven as the **Left Intercalary Qi**. Encountering the **Celestial Sovereign**, it is calculated to reach the **Celestial Pillar Obstruction**. **Wood** seeks to ascend, but the **Celestial Pillar Metal** and **Earthly Sovereign** overcome it, preventing progress. Additionally, in years of *Gēng-Xū* (庚戌), the **Metal phase** arrives prematurely, and the intervening **phase** overcomes it, suddenly halting its ascent. In a **Metal year**, the **Metal phase** arrives prematurely, and thirteen days later, **qi exchange** occurs. The **Celestial Sovereign** seeks to ascend, but the intervening **Metal phase** suppresses it.*

*When the **Wood phase** ascends to Heaven, **Metal** suppresses it."*

chunks.original_text: 或上见天柱窒，或中见金运也。 升而不前，即清生风少，肃杀於春，露霜复降，草木乃萎。 民病温疫早发，咽嗑乃乾，四肢满，肢节皆痛，久而化郁。 至天得左问日，乃发作也。 即大风摧拉，折陨呜素。 民病卒中褊痹，手足不仁。 青埃见时，风疫乃作，民反张肢体直强，治之达三俞也。 是故巳亥之岁，君火升天，主窒天蓬，胜之不前。 君火以在地三年，至巳亥之岁，少阴升天作左问也，此可定之也。 天蓬水司水，《天元册》用除算至坎官，除其数者，即天蓬窒作主司，故水窒胜也。 又厥阴木迁正，则少阴未得升天，水运以至其中者。 君火欲升，而中水运抑之。 即天蓬水司胜，即或水运抑之。 升之不前，即清寒复作，玲生旦暮。 民病伏阳，而内生烦热，心神惊悸，寒热间作，日久成郁。 二七日不降，以为日久也。 即暴热乃至，赤风肿翳化疫，温疠暖作。 至天作左问日乃作也，民病伏热内烦，痹而生厥，甚则血溢也。 赤气瘴而化火疫，皆烦而躁渴，渴甚治之，以泄之可止。 是故子午之岁，太阴升天，主窒天冲，胜之不前。 太阴在地二#2年毕，一年乃升天，作少阴之左问也，此即定矣。 其天冲窒，至有法，即不可前定之也。 如会天冲窒，即土不可便升之也，故日升之不前也。 又或遇壬子，木运先天而至者，中木遇抑之也。 木升於大寒之日也，木早至十三日上，故升或遇此二木抑之者，土迁抑甚，而病深之也。 升天不前，即风埃四起，时举埃昏，雨湿不化，民病风厥涎潮，偏痹不随，胀满，久而伏郁。 即十日不升者，至以为日久也。 即黄埃化疫也。 问气上郁之大疫也。 民病夭亡，脸肢府黄疸满闭，湿令弗布，雨化乃微。 黄埃起而黄风化疫，皆肢体痛而口苦者也。 是故丑未之年，少阳升天，主窒天蓬，胜之不前。 少阴在地三年毕，至此岁升天，作太阴左问也，此可前定之也。 天蓬失算位，取之法不定也。 或遇之者，即水运之可升之於火，故不可便升也。 又或遇太阴未迁正者，即少阴未升天也，水运以至者。 即升天不前者，有此二抑之者也。 升天不前，即寒露反布，凛冽如冬，水复涸，冰再结，暄暖乍作，玲复布之，寒暄不时，民病伏阳在内，烦热生中，心神惊骇，寒热问争，以久成郁。 二七不降，以为日久也。 即暴热乃生，赤风气瞳翳。 至天得位之日乃作。 化成郁疠，乃化作伏热内烦，痹而生厥，甚则血溢。 赤气生而化大疫，皆烦而大热，凉药不可制於火之郁，甚於君火，故厥乃血溢也。 是故寅申之年，阳明升天，主窒天英，胜之不前。 阳明在地三年毕，至此年升天，作少阳左问也，即经论中乃定矣。 九窒随天数不足，金遇火窒之，可胜之，不可升天。 又或遇戊申、戊寅，火运先天而至。 太过岁未交司，运先至一十三日。 金欲升天，火运抑之。 此者遇一即不可升也，或二者同会，其抑大也。 升之不前，即时雨不降，西风数举，咸卤燥生。 地咸卤生白，见硝而燥生也。 民病上热，喘嗽血溢，久而化郁。 四九不升，火为日久也。 即白埃翳雾，清生杀气，民病胁满悲伤，寒欤嚏哑乾，手拆皮肤燥。 白埃起时，杀疫火生，民病皆燥而咽乾，治可刺之也。 是故卯酉之年，太阳升天，主窒天内，胜之不前。

「Sometimes it ascends and meets the **Celestial Pillar Obstruction**, or sometimes it encounters the **Metal phase** in mid-course.

When it ascends but does not progress, the **clear and pure** *qi* generates **wind** and **lessened vitality**, while **austerity and killing** prevail in **Spring**. **Dew and frost** return, and **grass and trees wither**.

The people suffer from **epidemic febrile diseases** that appear early, with **throat and mouth dryness**, limbs full and joints all aching—if prolonged, it transforms into **stagnant *qi*** (郁). By the day when **Heaven obtains the Left Intercalary Qi**, the disease erupts.

Then **great winds** uproot and scatter, causing **collapses and sudden deaths**. The people fall ill with **sudden paralysis** and **numbness in hands and feet**.

When **green dust** appears, **wind-febrile diseases** arise, and the people stretch their limbs rigidly, as if in **spasm** (直强). Treatment must reach the **three *yu*** (俞) points. Thus, in *Wèi-Hài* (巳亥) years, the **Sovereign Fire** ascends to Heaven, obstructed by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction**, and cannot progress.

The **Sovereign Fire** remains on Earth for three years; by *Wèi-Hài* years, **Jué-Yin** ascends to Heaven as the **Left Intercalary Qi**, which is fixed. **Celestial Pillar Water** governs **Water**, and according to *The Celestial Element Manual* (《天元册》), its calculation extends to the **Kàn Official** (坎官). When its number is subtracted, **Celestial Pillar Obstruction** becomes the governing force, so **Water** is obstructed and suppressed.

Additionally, if **Jué-Yin Wood** shifts to its proper position, **Jué-Yin** has not yet ascended to Heaven, and the **Water phase** arrives in between. The **Sovereign Fire** seeks to ascend, but the **Water phase** in mid-course suppresses it. When **Celestial Pillar Water** governs and suppresses, it is either the **Water phase** itself that obstructs it.

When it ascends but does not progress, **clear cold** returns, and **dew** appears at dawn and dusk. The people suffer from **latent *yang*** (伏阳), with internal **restlessness and heat**, a **startled and fearful spirit**, and alternating **cold and heat**, eventually leading to **stagnant *qi*** (郁). If **cold and heat** persist for **forty-nine days** (二七), it is considered prolonged. Then **violent heat** emerges, **red wind** causes **pupillary dilation** and **clouding of vision**, transforming into **epidemic febrile diseases** (疫), with **warm diseases** (温疠) also arising.

By the day when **Heaven obtains its proper position**, the disease manifests. It evolves into **stagnant pestilence** (郁疠), generating **latent heat** and internal **restlessness**, leading to **paralysis with sudden attacks** (痹而生厥), and in severe cases, **blood overflows** (血溢).

When **red *qi*** (赤气) arises and transforms into **great epidemic febrile diseases** (大疫), all suffer from **restlessness and intense thirst**, with severe thirst being the key to treatment—**draining** it can halt the disease.

Thus, in *Zǐ-Wǔ* (子午) years, **Great Yin** ascends to Heaven, obstructed by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Chōng** (天冲), and cannot progress.

**Great Yin** remains on Earth for two years; in the following year, it ascends to Heaven as **Jué-Yin’s Left Intercalary Qi**, which is fixed. **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Chōng**, however, has its own method—it cannot be definitively calculated in advance.

If **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Chōng** is encountered, **Earth** cannot easily ascend it, hence the saying: *"it ascends but does not progress."*

Additionally, if it meets *Rén-Zǐ* (壬子), the **Wood phase** arrives prematurely. **Wood** ascends on the day of **Great Cold** (大寒), and if it arrives early, **thirteen days** before its proper time, it encounters these two **Wood suppressions** (抑). **Earth** shifts and suppresses it greatly, resulting in deep illness.

When it does not ascend to Heaven, **wind dust** rises in all directions, causing **dusty haze** (埃昏) at times, with **rain and dampness** failing to dissipate. The people suffer from **wind-paralysis** (风厥), **drooling and tides of heat** (涎潮), **one-sided paralysis** (偏痹) that does not follow the limbs, **distension and fullness**, and prolonged **latent *qi* stagnation** (伏郁).

If it fails to ascend for **ten days**, it is considered prolonged. Then **yellow dust** transforms into **epidemic febrile diseases** (疫). The **Intercalary Qi** ascending to **stagnant *qi*** (郁) becomes a **great epidemic** (大疫).

The people suffer from **early death**, with **yellow jaundice** closing over the face, limbs, and flanks. **Dampness** does not spread, and **rain dissipates** only slightly. When **yellow dust** rises and **yellow wind** transforms into **epidemic febrile diseases**, all suffer from **limb pain** and **bitter taste in the mouth**.

Thus, in *Chǒu-Wèi* (丑未) years, **Lesser Yang** ascends to Heaven, obstructed by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Pēng** (天蓬), and cannot progress.

**Lesser Yin** remains on Earth for three years; by this year, it ascends to Heaven as **Great Yin’s Left Intercalary Qi**, which is fixed. **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Pēng** loses its calculated position, and there is no fixed method for its occurrence.

If it is encountered, the **Water phase** can ascend to **Fire**, so it cannot easily ascend. Additionally, if **Great Yin** has not yet shifted to its proper position, **Lesser Yin** has not yet ascended to Heaven, and the **Water phase** arrives in between. When it does not ascend to Heaven, these two suppressions occur.

If it does not ascend to Heaven, **cold dew** reappears, and the chill is as severe as in **Winter** (凛冽如冬). **Water** returns to its dry state, and **ice reforms**. **Warmth** suddenly appears, while **dew** spreads again. **Cold and warmth** are untimely, and the people suffer from **latent *yang*** within, with **restlessness and heat** in the middle, a **startled and terrified spirit**, and **cold and heat** contending alternately, eventually leading to **stagnant *qi*** (郁). If **cold and heat** persist for **forty-nine days**, it is considered prolonged.

Then **violent heat** emerges, causing **red wind** and **pupillary dilation with clouded vision**. By the day when **Heaven obtains its proper position**, the disease manifests. It evolves into **stagnant pestilence** (郁疠), generating **latent heat** and internal **restlessness**, leading to **paralysis with sudden attacks** (痹而生厥), and in severe cases, **blood overflows**.

When **red *qi*** (赤气) arises and transforms into **great epidemic febrile diseases** (大疫), all suffer from **restlessness and intense heat**. **Cool medicines** cannot subdue the **stagnant *yang* fire** (火之郁), which is more severe than the **Sovereign Fire**, hence **paralysis with sudden blood overflow** (厥乃血溢).

Thus, in *Yín-Shēn* (寅申) years, **Bright Yang** ascends to Heaven, obstructed by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Yīng** (天英), and cannot progress.

**Bright Yang** remains on Earth for three years; by this year, it ascends to Heaven as **Lesser Yang’s Left Intercalary Qi**, which is fixed as per the **scriptures and commentaries**.

**Nine Obstructions** (九窒) follow the **Heavenly cycles** but are insufficient; **Metal** encounters **Fire Obstruction**, which can suppress it but cannot ascend to Heaven. If it meets *Wù-Shēn* (戊申) or *Wù-Yín* (戊寅), the **Fire phase** arrives prematurely.

In years where the **Fire phase** exceeds its proper time, the **phase exchange** has not yet occurred, and the **Fire phase** arrives **thirteen days** early. **Metal** seeks to ascend to Heaven, but the **Fire phase** suppresses it. If it encounters one such suppression, it cannot ascend; if two coincide, the suppression is even greater.

When it ascends but does not progress, **timely rains** fail to descend, and **west winds** rise frequently, generating **salty and arid *qi*** (咸卤燥). **Earth’s salty and arid *qi*** (地咸卤) produces **whiteness**, and when **nitre** (硝) appears, **dryness** arises.

The people suffer from **upper-body heat**, **wheezing and coughing with blood overflow**, and prolonged **stagnant *qi*** (郁). If it does not ascend for **forty-nine days**, **Fire** is considered prolonged.

Then **white dust** clouds the air, **clear *qi*** generates **killing energy** (杀气), and the people suffer from **flank distension and melancholy**, **chronic cold with sneezing and hoarseness**, and **dry skin that cracks** (手拆皮肤). When **white dust** rises, **killing epidemic febrile diseases** (杀疫) and **fire diseases** (火生) emerge, and the people all suffer from **dryness and throat constriction**—treatment can involve **acupuncture**.

Thus, in *Mǎo-Yǒu* (卯酉) years, **Celestial Sovereign** ascends to Heaven, obstructed by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Nèi** (天内), and cannot progress.

chunks.original_text: 太阳在地三年毕，此年升天，作阳明之左问也，即经论定矣。 升天即天内从之，数法推之也。 水遇土窒之司，胜之不可升之，抑而复鲜。 又遇阳明未迁正者，即太阳未升天也，土运以至。 己酉、己卯。 水欲升天，土运抑之。 或见天内窒，土刑胜之，或见土运抑之，有一不胜也。 升之不前，即湿而热蒸，寒生两问。 民病注不食不及化，久而成郁。 十二日不降，为日久也。 冷来客热，冰雹卒至。 民病厥逆而秽，热生於内，气痹於外，足腥酸疼，反生（心悸懊热，暴烦而复厥。 一黑埃起至寒疫至，皆烦而悸厥，治之。 可溢也。 黄帝曰：升之不前，余已尽知其旨。 一愿闻降之不下，可得明乎？ 再欲细明其道也。 岐伯日：悉乎哉问。 是之谓天地微旨，可以尽陈斯道，所谓升已必降也。 一升至天作左问一年，二年迁正作司天，三年退位作右间，四年后降也。 至天三年，次岁必降，降而入地，始为左问也。 入地作左问一年，次岁作迁正司地，又次岁乃退作右问也。 如此升降往来，命之六纪者矣。 三而在天，三而在地，一岁弗从，命乎灾害，先明其升，次穷其降也。 是故丑未之岁，厥阴降地，主窒地晶，胜而不前。 又厥阴在天三年，次年爻降，又遇地九窒中，地晶西方兑塞，金司胜之，不可使入其地也，抑之不入，乃化成民病也。 又或遇少阴未退位。 少阴天数有余，作布政，故未退一位也。 即厥阴未降下，金运以至中。 或遇乙丑、乙未，中见金抑之也。 金运承之，降之未下，抑之变郁。 郁伏之气降而不下，成其民病。 木欲降下，金承之，降而不下，苍埃远见，白气承之，风举埃昏，清躁行杀，霜露复下，肃杀布令。 久而不降，抑之化郁。 三日不降八日降，不降化风疫也。 即作风躁相伏，暄而反清，草木萌动，杀霜乃垫未见#3惧清伤藏。 暄和令节，大清杀之，复布杀霜，苍埃见时风疫至，治之吐而得，复不可下。 是故寅申之岁，少阴降地，主窒地玄，胜之不入。 少阴在天三年，四年即降，又遇地窒，主司地玄，窒水司降而不入，抑伏化为民病也。 又或遇丙申、丙寅，水运太过，先天而至。 水运太过，至其中即少阴降而不下，乃成其郁，与民为其灾也。 君火欲降，水运承之，降而不下，即彤云才见，黑气反生，暄暖如舒，寒常布灵，凛冽复作，天云惨赓，久而不降，伏之化郁。 二日不降七日降，不降即郁发。 寒胜复热，赤风化疫，民病面赤心烦，头痛目眩也，赤气彰，而温病欲作也。 民皆夜外不安，黄风化疫，解可泄也。 是故卯酉之岁，太阴降地，主室地苍，胜之不入。 太阴在天三年，至此年降入地，作少阴左问也。 又遇主窒地苍窒，木司胜之不入也。 又或少阳未退位者，即太阴未得降也，或木运以至。 丁酉、丁卯。 木运承之，降而不下，即黄云见而青霞彰，郁蒸作而大风雾翳埃胜，折损乃作，久而不降也，伏之化郁。 十日不降，为日久也。 天埃黄气，地布湿蒸，民病四肢不举，昏眩肢节痛，腹满填臆。 黄风三举，民病温湿，皆痞满，治可大下愈。 是故辰戌之岁，少阳降地，主窒地玄，胜之不入。 少阳在天三年毕，次年下降入地，作太阴左问，主地玄窒，水司胜不入，而化民病也。 又或遇水运太过，先天而至也。

「When the **Celestial Sovereign** (太阳) completes its three-year tenure on Earth, this year it ascends to Heaven, acting as the **left minister of Yangming** (阳明之左问), which is already defined in the *Canon* (经) and *Commentaries* (论). Its ascent to Heaven is accompanied by **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Nèi** (天内), as the sequential laws dictate. When **Water** encounters **Earth**’s obstruction, it cannot ascend, and though it is subdued, it remains vibrant.

Again, if it meets **Yangming** (阳明) before it has moved to its proper position—meaning the **Celestial Sovereign** has not yet ascended to Heaven—**Earth**’s influence arrives instead. In **Jǐ-Yǒu** (己酉) and **Jǐ-Mǎo** (己卯) years, **Water** seeks to ascend to Heaven, but **Earth**’s influence suppresses it. Sometimes, one sees **Celestial Pillar Obstruction of Nèi** (天内) suppressing it, or **Earth**’s influence subduing it—either way, there is an imbalance. When it ascends but does not progress, **dampness and heat** (湿而热) steam, giving rise to **twofold cold** (寒生两问). The people suffer from **stagnant *qi*** (郁) that does not disperse, lingering until it becomes prolonged. If it does not descend for **twelve days**, it is considered prolonged.

When **cold** arrives as a guest and **heat** prevails, **hail and ice pellets** (冰雹) suddenly descend. The people suffer from **ulcerative cold** (厥逆而秽), where **heat** festers within and **cold *qi*** stagnates without, causing **foot foulness, acidity, and pain** (足腥酸疼). This may also generate **palpitations, restlessness, and heat** (心悸懊热), sudden agitation followed by **ulcerative cold** (而复厥). When **black dust** (一黑埃) rises, leading to **cold epidemic febrile diseases** (寒疫), the people all suffer from **agitation and palpitations** (皆烦而悸厥)—treatment can involve **emesis** (吐).

The **Yellow Emperor** (黄帝) asked: *"When it ascends but does not progress, I have already understood its meaning. Now I wish to hear about when it descends but does not descend—can I gain clarity?"* He sought further elucidation of this **Dao** (道).

**Qī-Bó** (岐伯) replied: *"Your question is thorough indeed! This is what is called the **subtle interplay of Heaven and Earth** (天地微旨), and through this, the full **Dao** (道) of ascent and descent can be revealed. Just as it is said: 'Ascension must be followed by descent.'*

The **Celestial Sovereign** ascends to Heaven as the **left minister for one year**, then in the **second year** it moves to its proper position as **Sovereign of Heaven** (司天), in the **third year** it retires to become the **right minister** (右问), and by the **fourth year**, it descends. After three years in Heaven, it must descend in the following year. Upon descending into Earth, it begins once more as the **left minister**.

As the **left minister on Earth for one year**, the next year it becomes **Sovereign of Earth** (司地) in its proper position, and the following year it retires to become the **right minister**. Thus, the cycle of ascent, descent, and return is called the **Six Periods** (六纪).

Three years in Heaven, three years on Earth—if it does not descend in a year, it brings **calamities and disasters** (灾害). First, one must clarify its ascent; then, one must exhaustively explore its descent. Therefore, in **Chǒu-Wèi** (丑未) years, **Celestial Sovereign of Gǔyīn** (厥阴) descends to Earth, obstructing **Earth’s Clarity** (地晶), and though subdued, it does not enter fully.

Again, if **Gǔyīn** remains in Heaven for three years, the next year it descends, but it also encounters **Earth’s Ninefold Obstruction** (地九窒), where **Earth’s Clarity** (地晶) in the west is blocked by **Jué** (兑), and **Metal** (金) governs its suppression, preventing it from entering its proper domain. When suppressed and unable to enter, it transforms into **diseases among the people** (民病).

Sometimes it meets **Shàoyīn** (少阴) before its retreat. **Shàoyīn** has excess influence in Heaven, acting as the **Administrator of Affairs** (布政), and thus has not yet retreated one position. When **Gǔyīn** has not yet descended, **Metal**’s influence arrives in the middle. In **Yǐ-Chǒu** (乙丑) and **Yǐ-Wèi** (乙未) years, one sees **Metal** suppressing it. When **Metal**’s influence follows and suppresses it, the descent does not occur, and the **stagnant *qi*** (郁) lingers, forming **diseases among the people** (民病).

When **Wood** seeks to descend, **Metal** follows and suppresses it. If it does not descend, **blue dust** (苍埃) appears from afar, and **white *qi*** (白气) follows, with **wind** lifting the dust into a dim haze. **Clear and restless *qi*** (清躁) then brings **killing energy** (杀), and **frost and dew** descend again, issuing **stern and killing decrees** (肃杀布令). If it lingers and does not descend, the suppressed **stagnant *qi*** (郁) transforms into **diseases among the people**. **Bingchen (丙辰) and Bingxu (丙戌) years are those of the Water cycle (水运).** When Water’s cycle is ascendant yet does not descend, even if **scarlet clouds** (彤云) appear faintly, **black qi** (黑气) surges forth, **warmth** (暄暖) threatens to arise, and **cold qi** (玲气) suddenly strikes—at its worst, it brings **hail and ice** (冰雹). If it lingers without descending, the suppression turns into **stagnant dampness** (郁). When it does not descend for two days but descends on the seventh, if it fails to descend, **stagnant dampness** erupts.

If **cold qi** (冷气) clashes with **heat** (热), **red wind** (赤风) transforms into **epidemic pestilence** (化疫), and the people suffer from **flushed faces and restless hearts** (清面赤心烦), **headaches and blurred vision** (头痛目眩). When **red qi** (赤气) is prominent and **heat diseases** (热病) are about to emerge, the people fall ill with **insomnia and restlessness** (夜讣不安). **Yellow wind** (黄风) transforms into **epidemic pestilence** (化疫), and relief may come from **draining** (泄) it to heal.

Thus, in **Weihai (巳亥) years**, **Yangming** (阳明) descends to Earth, obstructing **Earth’s Scarlet Depths** (地彤), yet though subdued, it does not enter fully. **Yangming** remains in Heaven for three years; the following year, it descends into Earth, becoming **Shàoyáng’s left minister** (少阳左问). If it encounters **Earth’s Scarlet Depths** (地彤), **Fire** (火) governs the suppression, preventing it from entering, and this transforms into **disease** (化成病). If **Tàiyīn** (太阴) has not yet relinquished its position, then **Shàoyáng** (少阳) cannot descend, and **Fire’s cycle** (火运) arrives instead.

**Guiwei (癸巳) and Guihai (癸亥) years** are those of the **Fire cycle** (火运). When Fire’s cycle is ascendant yet does not descend, the sky clears and grows **stern** (肃), and **red qi** (赤气) becomes prominent, **heat** (暄热) surges back, leaving the people all **drowsy and restless** (昏倦), unable to sleep at night. Their throats grow **dry, prompting them to drink** (咽乾引饮), and they suffer from **internal heat and agitation** (懊热内烦). In the morning, the air is **clear and cold** (大清), but by evening, **heat returns** (暄还复作). If it does not descend for nine days, the suppression turns into **stagnant dampness** (郁). When it does not descend for four days but descends on the ninth, if it fails to descend, **stagnant dampness** erupts.

If the sky is **clear and thin with cold** (黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之四 #1), **white qi** (白气) arises from afar, and the people suffer from **vertigo and numbness in limbs** (掉眩), **straightened limbs without sensation** (手足直而不仁), **pain in the sides and mouth** (两胁口□#5), and **eyes appearing blurred** (满目忙忙). When **white qi** is abundant and **killing epidemics** (杀疫) arrive, the people all become **dry, with parched throats and constricted breathing** (燥而咽乾轨钮), and treatment can involve **acupuncture** (刺) to relieve them.

Thus, in **Ziwu (子午) years**, **Tàiyáng** (太阳) descends to Earth, obstructing **Earth’s Obstructed Depths** (地阜), yet though subdued, it does not enter fully. **Tàiyáng** remains in Heaven for three years; the following year, it descends again into Earth, becoming **Yangming’s left minister** (阳明左问). If it encounters **Earth’s Obstructed Depths** (地阜), **Earth** (土) governs the suppression, preventing it from entering, and this transforms into **disease** (化成病). If **Earth’s cycle** (土运) is excessive, it arrives before its proper time.

chunks.original_text: 土运承之，降而不入，即天彰黑气，暝暗赓惨，才施黄埃而布湿，寒化令气，蒸湿复令。 久而不降，伏之化郁。 十二日不降者，即郁其发也。 民病大厥，四肢重怠，阴痿少力，天布沉阴，蒸湿问作。 黑气彰而寒疫至，民病皆厥而体重，治可益之也。 帝曰：升降不前，晰知其宗。 愿闻迁正，可得明乎？ 晰，明也。 岐伯日：正司中位，是谓迁正位。 司天不得其迁正者，即前司天以过交司之日。 以过大寒日，别岁正之，初气未至也。 即遇司天太过有余日也，即仍旧治天数，新司天未得迁正也。 年即以交，即司天之气未交司故也。 厥阴不迁正，即风暄不时，花卉萎瘁，民病淋搜，目系转，转筋喜怒，小便赤。 太阳司天，天数有余，如退位之日，厥阴得治迁正也。 风欲令而寒由不去，温暄不正，春正失时。 虽得初气，天令不传，木气不伸，民乃病肝。 少阴不迁正，即冷气不退，春玲复寒，暄暖不时，民病寒热，四肢烦痛，腰脊强直。 厥阴司天，天数有余。 厥阴虽有余日，别位司天，皆天数终日始迁正，如少阴至二月春分得位正之时，乃造化变，便可迁正，乃合司天也。 木气虽有余，位不过於君火也。 木气有余数，不尽有余日，复治天，治数未终，遇君火得时化，春分日便可迁正，木犹未退，即可同治於天也。 其余气皆无此也。 太阴不迁正，即云雨失令，万物枯焦，当生不发。 民病手足肢节肿满，大腹水肿，填臆不食，飧泄胁满，四肢不举。 少阴司天，天数未终，故日太阴不得迁正。 少阴数终，可得迁正也。 雨化欲令，热犹治之，温煦於气，亢而不泽。 少阴有余，未尽天数，故不退位，即太阴未得迁正，即土气不申，而民病於脾也。 少阳不迁正，即炎灼弗令，苗莠不荣，酷暑於秋，肃杀晚至，霜露不时。 民病瘤疟，骨热，心悸惊骇，甚时血溢。 虽有寅申之年，土尚治之，退位之日，火行酷暑於后，故涉暑於秋也。 阳明不迁正，则暑化於前，肃於后，草木反荣。 民病寒热叹嚏，皮毛折，爪甲枯焦，甚则喘嗽#1息高，悲伤不乐。 少阳司天，天数有余，如退位日，阳明不迁正也。 热化乃布，燥化未令，即清劲未行，肺金复病。 虽得卯酉之年，犹火化热之令也，故肺重复受病。 太阳不迁正，即冬清反寒，易令於春，杀霜在前，寒冰於后，阳光复治，凛冽不作，露云待时。 民病温疠至，喉闭溢#2乾，烦燥而渴，喘息而有音也。 阳明司天，天数有余，退位日太阳迁正，故多烦燥渴喘者也。 寒化待燥，犹治天气，过失序，与民作灾。 虽得辰戌之年，犹尚清化治天，故失序也。 帝曰：迁正早晚，以命其旨，愿闻退位，可得明哉？ 岐伯日：所谓不退者，即天数未终。 天数未终，其气仍治，虽遇交司，由未退位也。 即天数有余，名曰复布政，故名日再治天也，即天令如故而不退位也。 此治天下过而不退位，犹在天。 厥阴不退位，即大风早举，时雨不降，湿令不化。 民病温疫，疵废风生，民病皆肢节头目痛，伏热内烦，咽喉乾引饮。 厥阴天数有余，在本数之上司天，气高而灾化善也，令作布政而复下灾，故反甚之者也。 少阴不退位，即温生春冬，垫虫早至，草木发生。 民病膈热咽乾，血溢惊骇，小便赤涩，丹瘤疹疮疡留毒。

**Earth’s Cycle** (土运) takes its turn, descending yet failing to enter—then **Heaven** (天) manifests the **black qi** (黑气), dim and gloomy, withering and harsh. Only then does **yellow dust** (黄埃) appear and spread dampness, while **cold** (寒) transforms the **qi** (气), and steaming dampness follows again.

If it lingers long without descending, the **qi** (气) becomes suppressed and stagnant. When **Earth’s Cycle** (土运) fails to descend for **twelve days** (十二日), its stagnation will erupt. The people suffer from **great collapse** (大厥), with limbs heavy and sluggish, **erectile dysfunction** (阴痿) and diminished strength. **Heaven** (天) spreads **deep yin** (沉阴), steaming dampness and **cold** (寒) together.

When **black qi** (黑气) is manifest and **cold epidemic** (寒疫) arrives, the people suffer from **collapse** (厥) and heavy limbs. Treatment may involve reinforcing them.

The Emperor said: *"The ascending and descending do not proceed in order; I wish to understand its principle. May I hear of **Deranged Rectification** (迁正), so that I may grasp its meaning?"*
**Clarify** (晰) means **clear** (明).

**Giber** (岐伯) replied: *"**Rectification** (正) governs the central position; this is called **Deranged Rectification of Position** (迁正位). When **Heaven’s Official** (司天) fails to **Derange Rectification** (得其迁正), it is because **Heaven’s Official** (司天) arrives before its proper time, exceeding the **Great Cold** (大寒) day and altering the **year’s rectification** (岁正). The **initial qi** (初气) has not yet arrived. If **Heaven’s Official** (司天) is excessive with lingering days, it still follows the old **Heaven’s Rectification** (治天数), as the new **Heaven’s Official** (司天) has not yet **Deranged Rectification** (得迁正). The year is determined by the **exchange** (交), meaning **Heaven’s Official** (司天) has not yet completed its term.

When **Jueyin** (厥阴) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **wind and warmth** (风暄) are untimely, and flowers and plants wither. The people suffer from **dribbling urination** (淋搜), **ocular tension** (目系转), **spasmodic tetany** (转筋), and **anger-induced disorders** (喜怒), with **urine appearing red** (小便赤).

When **Taiyang** (太阳) governs **Heaven** (司天), its **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) lingers. On the day of **Retreating Rectification** (退位), **Jueyin** (厥阴) may **Derange Rectification** (得治迁正). **Wind** (风) seeks to order itself, yet **cold** (寒) lingers unresolved. Warmth and **dampness** (暄) are deranged, and **Spring Rectification** (春正) loses its proper time. Though the **initial qi** (初气) may arrive, **Heaven’s Command** (天令) does not propagate, and **Wood’s qi** (木气) does not unfold. Thus, the people fall ill with **liver disorders** (病肝).

When **Shaoyin** (少阴) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **cold qi** (冷气) does not retreat. **Spring** (春) lingers with **cold**, warmth and **dampness** (暄暖) are untimely, and the people suffer from **alternating cold and heat** (寒热), with limbs and back aching and **stiffness** (强直).

When **Jueyin** (厥阴) governs **Heaven** (司天), its **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) lingers. Though **Jueyin** (厥阴) may have lingering days, another **Rectification** (位) governs **Heaven** (司天), and all **Heaven’s Rectifications** (天数) must complete their full day before **Deranging Rectification** (迁正). For example, when **Shaoyin** (少阴) arrives at **Spring Equinox** (二月春分) to take its proper position, the **transformations** (造化) shift, and **Deranged Rectification** (迁正) may occur. This aligns with **Heaven’s Official** (司天).

Though **Wood’s qi** (木气) may linger, its position does not exceed that of **Jinghuo** (君火). If **Wood’s qi** (木气) has lingering days beyond its due, it again governs **Heaven** (治天), and its **Heaven’s Rectification** (治数) is not yet complete. When it encounters **Jinghuo** (君火) arriving on time, **Spring Equinox** (春分) allows **Deranged Rectification** (迁正), and **Wood’s qi** (木气) has not yet retreated. Thus, it may still align with **Heaven’s Rectification** (治天). The lingering **qi** of others does not behave thus.

When **Taiyin** (太阴) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **clouds and rain** (云雨) lose their proper ordering, and all things wither and dry. What should flourish does not. The people suffer from **swollen limbs and joints** (手足肢节肿满), **abdominal dropsy** (大腹水肿), **distended abdomen refusing food** (填臆不食), **chronic diarrhea with flank distension** (飧泄胁满), and **limbs failing to rise** (四肢不举).

When **Shaoyin** (少阴) governs **Heaven** (司天), its **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) is not yet complete, hence **Taiyin** (太阴) cannot **Derange Rectification** (得迁正). When **Shaoyin** (少阴) completes its term, **Taiyin** (太阴) may **Derange Rectification** (得迁正). **Rain’s transformation** (雨化) seeks to order itself, yet **heat** (热) still governs it. The warmth is gentle, yet **excessive** (亢) without **nourishment** (泽).

If **Shaoyin** (少阴) lingers beyond its due, **Earth’s qi** (土气) does not unfold properly, and the people fall ill with **spleen disorders** (病於脾).

When **Shaoyang** (少阳) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **scorching heat** (炎灼) does not arrive in order, and sprouts do not thrive. **Extreme summer heat** (酷暑) lingers into **Autumn**, **austerity and killing** (肃杀) arrive late, and **frost and dew** (霜露) are untimely. The people suffer from **nodular malaria** (瘤疟), **bone heat** (骨热), **palpitations and terror** (心悸惊骇), and in severe cases, **blood spattering** (血溢).

Though it may be the **Year of the Tiger** (寅) or the **Year of the Monkey** (申), **Earth** (土) still governs. On the day of **Retreating Rectification** (退位), **Fire** (火) brings **extreme summer heat** (酷暑) afterward, hence the lingering **summer heat into Autumn** (涉暑於秋).

When **Yangming** (阳明) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **summer heat** (暑) transforms prematurely, followed by **austerity** (肃) later, and grasses and trees flourish in reverse. The people suffer from **alternating cold and heat with sneezing** (寒热叹嚏), **hair and fur disorders** (皮毛折), **dry and brittle nails** (爪甲枯焦), and in severe cases, **shortness of breath and panting** (喘嗽), **high-pitched breathing** (息高), **sorrow and discontent** (悲伤不乐).

When **Shaoyang** (少阳) governs **Heaven** (司天), its **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) lingers. On the day of **Retreating Rectification** (退位), **Yangming** (阳明) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), hence there are many who suffer from **restlessness, thirst, and shortness of breath** (烦燥渴喘).

**Heat’s transformation** (热化) spreads, yet **dryness’s transformation** (燥化) does not arrive. **Clear and forceful** (清劲) **qi** (气) has not yet acted, and **Metal’s qi** (肺金) falls ill again. Though it may be the **Year of the Rabbit** (卯) or the **Year of the Rooster** (酉), **Fire’s transformation** (火化) still governs **heat’s ordering** (热之令), hence **Metal** (肺) bears the burden of illness again.

When **Taiyang** (太阳) fails to **Derange Rectification** (迁正), **winter cold** (冬清) reverses into **cold**, and **ease** (易令) arrives in **Spring**. **Killing frost** (杀霜) precedes, while **cold ice** (寒冰) follows. **Yang light** (阳光) again governs, with **piercing cold** (凛冽) not arising, and **dew and clouds** (露云) awaiting their proper time. The people suffer from **warm epidemic disorders** (温疠至), **closed throat with dryness** (喉闭溢乾), **restlessness and thirst** (烦燥而渴), and **shortness of breath with sound** (喘息而有音).

When **Yangming** (阳明) governs **Heaven** (司天), its **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) lingers. On the day of **Retreating Rectification** (退位), **Taiyang** (太阳) **Deranges Rectification** (迁正), hence there are many who suffer from **restlessness, thirst, and shortness of breath** (烦燥渴喘).

**Cold’s transformation** (寒化) awaits **dryness’s transformation** (燥), still governing **Heaven’s qi** (天气), yet **disordering the sequence** (失序), bringing calamity to the people. Though it may be the **Year of the Dragon** (辰) or the **Year of the Dog** (戌), **cold’s transformation** (清化) still governs **Heaven** (治天), hence the **disorder in sequence** (失序).

The Emperor said: *"The timing of **Deranged Rectification** (迁正) is early or late; I wish to understand its meaning. May I hear of **Retreating Rectification** (退位), so that I may grasp its clarity?"*

**Giber** (岐伯) replied: *"What is called **not retreating** (不退者) is when **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) is not yet complete. If **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) is not yet complete, its **qi** (气) still governs. Though it encounters the **exchange** (交司), it is because its **rectification** (位) has not yet retreated. If **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数) lingers, it is called **Reiterated Governance** (复布政), hence the term **re-governing Heaven** (再治天). **Heaven’s Command** (天令) remains as before, yet its **rectification** (位) does not retreat. This is **governing Heaven in excess** (治天下过), still lingering in **Heaven** (犹在天).

When **Jueyin** (厥阴) does not retreat, **great wind** (大风) arises early, and **timely rain** (时雨) does not descend. **Dampness’s ordering** (湿令) does not transform. The people suffer from **warm epidemic disorders** (温疫), **skin lesions with wind** (疵废风生), and all fall ill with **pain in limbs, head, and eyes** (皆肢节头目痛), **internal stagnant heat** (伏热内烦), and **dry throat compelling drinking** (咽喉乾引饮).

**Jueyin** (厥阴) has lingering **Heaven’s Rectification** (天数), governing **Heaven** (司天) above its proper term. Its **qi** (气) is high, yet its calamity transforms well. **Heaven’s Command** (令) acts as **Reiterated Governance** (布政) and again brings calamity below, hence the **reverse severity** (反甚之者).

When **Shaoyin** (少阴) does not retreat, **warmth** (温) arises in **Spring and Winter**, **stinging insects** (垫虫) arrive early, and grasses and trees sprout. The people suffer from **diaphragmatic heat** (膈热), **dry throat** (咽乾), **blood spattering and terror** (血溢惊骇), **red and painful urination** (小便赤涩), and **nodular rashes, eruptions, ulcers, and lingering toxins** (丹瘤疹疮疡留毒)."

chunks.original_text: 少阴天下#3有余，过岁而复作布政，天令酷灾矣。 太阴不退位，而取寒暑不时，埃昏布作，温令不去。 民病四肢少力，食饮不下，泄注淋满，足经寒，阴痿闭塞，失溺，小便数。 太阴天下#4有余，过岁而犹尚治天，其气其#5下矣，病至肾也。 少阳不退位，即热生於春，暑乃后化，冬温不冻，流水不冰，垫虫出见。 民病少气，寒热更作，便血上热，小腹坚满，小便赤沃，甚则血溢。 少阳天数有余，至过岁由治天，甚则气复下，其灾至脾肺藏也。 阳明不退位，即春生清玲，草木晚荣，寒热问作。 民病呕吐暴注，食饮不下，大便乾燥，四肢不举，目瞑掉眩。 阳明天数太过，至交岁而犹尚治天，气复降，其灾至甚於肝藏也。 帝日：天岁早晚，余以知之。 愿闻地数，可得闻乎？ 岐伯日：地下迁正升及退位不前之法，即地土产化，万物失时之化也。 即应之生万物之不时，数无次序，天令与民作灾，令於上下二干，失移之中者也。 帝曰：余闻天地二甲子，十二#6十二支，上下经纬天地，数有迭移，失守其位，可得昭乎？ 同天地二甲子，有上下不合其德者，为失守也。 岐伯曰：失之迭位者，谓虽得岁正，未得正位之司，即四时不节，即生大疫。 天地不合德，即名天地失节，即上下二管音不相应，即大不主与天主失节，上下失音，万物不安也。 注《玄珠密语》云：阳年三十年，除六年天刑，计有太过二十四年。 除庚子、庚午，君火刑金运； 庚寅、庚申，相火刑金运； 戊戌、戊辰，太阳刑火运也。 此为与其天地气，上临中运，不得太过者也。 除此六年，皆作太过之用，令不然之旨。 此即太过，作阳年中运余也，忽有上下，失支迭位，故不为者也。 今言迭支迭位，皆可作其不及也。 阳年者，运太过也，五音皆定矣，太音也，运自胜有余，而无邪伤，故名正化疫也。 其刚干不相对柔干，即上下不相招，即阴阳相错，天地不合德，中运虽阳多而作太过，故有胜复乃至者也。 假令甲子，阳年土运太窒。 土太过即运伤，鳞虫胜及，肾藏气不及，土胜於水也，即黄锺之管音高，故日太窒也。 候甲子之气应者，上应镇星，大而明也。 如癸亥天数有余者，年虽交得甲子。 甲虽临子，未得迁正。 厥阴犹尚治天。 年虽甲子司天，尚化风玲，厥阴犹复布正於天也。 地已迁正，阳明在泉。 或名司地，即数高者。 去岁少阳，以作右问。 癸亥司地，少阳退位，以作地下之右问气者也。 即厥阴之地阳明，故不相和奉者也。 故日上下不相招，阴阳有相错，即癸与巳相对，故天地不合德，即以不合甲也。 癸巳相会，土运太过，虚反受木胜，故非太过也。 何以言土运太过，昆黄锺不应太窒，木既胜而金还复，金既复而少阴如至，即木胜如火，而金复微。 谓少阴见厥阴退位，而少阴立至，故金欲复而火至，故复有少也。 如此则甲己失守，后三年化成土疫，晚至於卯。 甲子至丁卯四年至。 早至丙寅。 甲子至丙寅三年至。 土疫至也。 至於四维时也。 大小善恶，推其天地，详乎太一。 又只如甲子年，如甲至子而合，应交司而治天。 少阴主甲子年，司天迁正应时也。 即下己卯未迁正，而戊寅少阳未退位者，亦甲己下有合也。 即甲与戊相对，子与东酊个也。

Shaoyin’s **Heavenly Phase** (天下#3) is excessive, surpassing the year’s term and again enacting **Reiterated Governance** (布政). **Heaven’s Command** (天令) becomes harsh, its calamities severe.

Taiyin does not retreat from its position, causing **untimely cold and heat** (寒暑不时), **dusty haze and mist** (埃昏布作), and **warmth’s command** (温令) persisting. The people suffer **weak limbs** (四肢少力), **inability to eat or drink** (食饮不下), **diarrhea, dysentery, urinary retention** (泄注淋满), **cold in the leg channels** (足经寒), **erectile dysfunction and urinary blockage** (阴痿闭塞), **incontinence** (失溺), and **frequent urination** (小便数).

Taiyin’s **Heavenly Phase** (天下#4) remains excessive, extending past the year while still governing **Heaven** (治天). Its **qi** descends excessively (气其#5下矣), and its calamities reach the **kidneys** (病至肾也).

Shaoyang does not retreat from its position, causing **heat to arise in Spring**, **Summer’s transformation delayed**, **Winter warmth without frost**, **unfrozen flowing water**, and **early emergence of stinging insects** (垫虫出见). The people suffer **shortness of breath** (少气), **alternating chills and fever** (寒热更作), **rectal bleeding with upper-body heat** (便血上热), **firm, distended lower abdomen** (小腹坚满), **deep red, turbid urine** (小便赤沃), and in severe cases, **blood spattering** (血溢).

Shaoyang’s **Heavenly Phase** (天数) is excessive, extending past the year while still governing **Heaven** (治天). In extreme cases, its **qi** descends again (气复下), and its calamities afflict the **spleen and lungs** (灾至脾肺藏也).

Yangming does not retreat from its position, causing **Spring’s clear, crisp winds** (清玲) to arise late, **grasses and trees blooming tardily**, and **alternating chills and fever** (寒热问作). The people suffer **vomiting and sudden diarrhea** (呕吐暴注), **inability to eat or drink** (食饮不下), **constipation** (大便乾燥), **limbs unable to move** (四肢不举), **blurred vision and dizziness** (目瞑掉眩).

Yangming’s **Heavenly Phase** (天数) is excessively dominant, extending into the next year while still governing **Heaven** (治天). Its **qi** descends again (气复降), and its calamities severely afflict the **liver** (灾至甚於肝藏也).

The Emperor said: *"The early or late arrival of Heaven’s years—I understand this. May I inquire about Earth’s phases (地数), and may I hear them?"*

Gebi replied: *"The laws of Earth’s descent, ascent, and failure to retreat—these govern Earth’s soil transformations and the untimely changes in all things. When the proper timing for generating ten thousand things is disrupted, the sequence of phases is lost, and Heaven’s Command brings calamities to the people. This is when the upper and lower **Stems** (干) lose their proper alignment."*

The Emperor said: *"I have heard that Heaven and Earth’s **Two Heavenly Stems** (二甲子) and the **Twelve Branches** (十二支) weave the upper and lower patterns of Heaven and Earth. When their phases shift and fail to hold their positions, may this be clarified?"*

*"When the Two Heavenly Stems do not align in virtue (德), this is called **losing their guard** (失守)."*

Gebi said: *"When phases shift improperly, even if the year’s proper term is obtained, the governing phase is not secured. Then the four seasons are disordered, and great epidemics arise. When Heaven and Earth fail to align in virtue (德), this is called **Heaven and Earth losing their nodes** (失节). The upper and lower **Stems and Branches** (二管) do not harmonize in sound, and the **Great Clapper** (大不主) and **Heaven’s Master** (天主) lose their nodes. The upper and lower **Stems** are out of tune, and all things become unstable."*

The annotation from *The Secret Talks of the Mystic Pearl* (《玄珠密语》) states:
*"In a **Yang Year** (阳年), thirty years pass, excluding six years of **Heavenly Punishment** (天刑), leaving twenty-four years of excess. Excluding **Gengzi** (庚子) and **Gengwu** (庚午)—where **Metal** is punished by **Central Fire** (君火刑金运)—
**Gengyin** (庚寅) and **Gengshen** (庚申)—where **Relative Fire** (相火) punishes **Metal** (刑金运)—
**Wuxu** (戊戌) and **Wencheng** (戊辰)—where **Major Yang** (太阳) punishes **Fire** (刑火运).
These are the years when **Heaven and Earth’s qi** align with the **Central Cycle** (中运), and no excess occurs. Excluding these six years, all others function as **excessive years** (太过), contrary to their intended purpose. This is the **excess** within the **Yang Year’s Central Cycle** (阳年中运余). If there is an improper alignment of **Stems and Branches** (上下失支迭位), then it does not occur as intended. Now, when **Stems and Branches** shift improperly, they may also manifest as **deficiency** (不及).*

*A **Yang Year** is a **Central Cycle of Excess** (运太过). The **Five Phases’ sounds** (五音) are all fixed, and the **Great Sound** (太音) prevails. The **Central Cycle** overcomes its own phase with excess but suffers no perverse harm, hence it is called **proper transformation and epidemic** (正化疫). When the **Stems** of **Yang** do not correspond to the **Stems** of **Yin**, the upper and lower do not harmonize, **Yin and Yang** become disordered, and **Heaven and Earth** fail to align in virtue (德). Though the **Central Cycle** is excessive in **Yang**, it still produces **excessive overcoming** (胜复乃至).*

*For example, in a **Jiazi** (甲子) year, the **Central Cycle of Excess** is **Earth** (土运太窒). When **Earth** is excessive, it injures **Metal**, and **scaled insects** (鳞虫) prevail. The **kidney’s qi** is insufficient, as **Earth** overcomes **Water** (土胜於水). This is why the **Yellow Bell** (黄锺) **Stem’s sound** is high, hence it is called **excessively constricted** (太窒).*

*The **Jiazi** year’s **qi** corresponds above to the **Zhen Star** (镇星), which is grand and bright. For instance, in a **Guihai** (癸亥) year with an excessive **Heavenly Phase** (天数有余), though the year transitions to **Jiazi**, **Jia** governs **Zi** but has not yet ascended to its proper position (迁正). **Jueyin** still governs **Heaven** (治天). Though **Jiazi** governs **Heaven** by term, it still transforms into **wind and crispness** (化风玲), and **Jueyin** continues to enact **Reiterated Governance** (布正於天) in **Heaven**. **Earth** has already ascended to its proper position, with **Yangming** at the **Spring** (在泉). It is also called **governing Earth** (司地), referring to the phase with high **Heavenly Phase** (数高者). The previous year was **Shaoyang**, which governed the **right question** (右问). **Guihai** governs **Earth**, and **Shaoyang** has retreated from its position, thus governing the **Earth’s right question qi** (地下之右问气). This is why **Jueyin’s Earth** and **Yangming** do not harmonize in their duties (不相和奉). Hence, it is said that the upper and lower do not harmonize (上下不相招), **Yin and Yang** become disordered (阴阳有相错), and **Gui** and **Si** oppose each other (癸与巳相对), so **Heaven and Earth** fail to align in virtue (天地不合德). This is because they do not align with **Jia** (以不合甲也). When **Gui** and **Si** converge (癸巳相会), the **Earth Central Cycle** is excessive, yet **Wood** prevails in vain, and **Metal** counterattacks. When **Metal** counterattacks, **Shaoyin** appears as if it has arrived, but **Wood** prevails like **Fire**, while **Metal**’s counterattack is weak. This is because **Shaoyin** appears while **Jueyin** has not yet retreated, and **Shaoyin** establishes itself. **Metal** seeks to counterattack, but **Fire** arrives, hence the **counterattack is slight** (复有少也). Thus, **Jia** and **Ji** lose their guard (甲己失守), and three years later, an **Earth epidemic** (土疫) manifests, reaching **Mao** (卯) late. From **Jiazi** to **Dingmao** (丁卯) spans four years. If it arrives early, it reaches **Bingyin** (丙寅) in three years. When the **Earth epidemic** arrives, it is the time of the **Four Directions** (四维). Good or bad, great or small—this is deduced from **Heaven and Earth’s** alignment, examined through **Taiyi** (太一).*

*Again, take the **Jiazi** year: if **Jia** aligns with **Zi** upon exchange, it should govern **Heaven** by term (应交司而治天). **Shaoyin** governs the **Jiazi** year, ascending to its proper position in time (司天迁正应时). Below, **Ji**, **Mao**, and **Wei** have not yet ascended to their proper positions, while **Wuyin** (戊寅) **Shaoyang** has not retreated. There is also an alignment below between **Jia** and **Ji** (甲己下有合). **Jia** opposes **Wu** (甲与戊相对), and **Zi** opposes **Ding** (子与东酊个)."

chunks.original_text: 即土运非太过，而木乃乘虚而胜土也。 金次又行复胜之，即反邪化也。 即胜之小而或不复，后三年化疠，名日土疠，其状如土疫者，本是自天来疠，从地至，故反化邪生也。 阴阳天地殊异尔，故其大小善恶，一如天地之法旨也。 假令丙寅阳年太过，如乙丑天数有余者，虽交得丙寅。 虽丙得寅，犹未迁正而作司天。 太阴尚治天也，地已迁正，厥阴司地。 或作在泉。 去岁太阳，以作右问。 乙丑司地，庚辰以退位而作右问。 即天太阴而地厥，故地不奉天化也。 即上下不相招，阴阳有相错，即辛与乙不相合，故不合其德也。 乙辛相会，水运太虚，反受土胜，故非太过，即太簇之管，太羽不应，土胜而雨化，水复即风。 即天地非其时而有其气，有化大疫，即与阴阳复不同也。 此者丙辛失守其会，后三年化成水疫，晚至己巳。 丙寅至己巳四年。 早至戊辰。 丙寅至戊辰三年。 甚即速，微即徐。 徐至己巳。 水疫至也，大小善恶推其天地数，乃太乙游宫。 又只如丙寅年，丙至寅且合，应交司而治天。 少阳至而作司天，应时迁正。 即辛巳未得迁正，而庚辰太阳未退位者，亦丙辛不合德也。 即丙与庚相对，辰与寅相配位也，即水运非太过也。 即水运亦小虚而小胜，或有复。 丙寅至也，即无复也。 后三年化疠，名日水疠，其状如水疫。 一名寒疫。 治法如前。 假令庚辰阳年太过，如己卯天数有余者，虽交得庚辰年也。 虽庚临辰，未迁正。 阳明犹尚治天，地以迁正，太阴司地。 即是在泉。 云#7岁少阴，以作右问。 己卯年，地甲子以退少阴，作右问也。 即天阳明而地太阴也，故地下奉天也。 乙巳相会，金运太虚，反受火胜，故非太过也，即姑洗之管，太商不应，火胜热化，水复寒刑。 此天地非时，行不节之令，即三年始成大疫，行天下也。 此乙庚失守，其后三年，化成金疫也。 速至壬午。 庚辰至壬午三年，是其速至。 徐至癸未，金疫至也，大小善恶，推本年天数及太乙也。 疫至之年，又遇失守，其灾大也。 不见五福及其太乙，且恶死人太半也。 如却会合德者，灾小尔。 如见五福与其太一者，其灾且小善灭#8其半也。 又只如庚辰，如庚至辰，且应交司而治天。 太阳主庚辰年司天，应时迁正而治天也。 即下乙未未得迁正者，即地甲午少阴未退位者，且乙庚不合德也。 即甲庚相对，辰午相配，此令失守，非配太过。 即下乙未干失刚，亦金运小虚也，有小胜或无复。 太阴至未，即不复也。 后三年化疠，名日金疠，其状如金疫也。 金疫又名杀疫，金疠又名杀疠。 治法如前。 假令壬午阳年太过，如辛巳天数有余者，虽交后壬午年也。 虽壬临午，犹未迁正。 厥阴犹尚治天，地已迁正，阳明在泉。 丁酉治也。 去岁丙申，少阳以作右问。 壬午年丁酉迁正，辛巳年丙申退位也。 即天厥阴而地阳明，故地不奉天者也。 即阳明当上奉少阴，不与厥阴奉合也，故丁酉与辛巳不相合德也。 丁辛相合会，木运太虚，反受金胜，故非太过也。 即萝宾之管，太角不应，金行燥胜，火化热复。 此天地非时行不节之气，即三年始成大疫。 甚即速，微即徐。 速即首尾二#9年，徐即后三年作。 疫至大小善恶，推疫至之年天数及太一。 又只如壬至午，且应交司而治之。

「Now, if the **Earth epidemic** (*tǔ yì* 土疫) is not excessive (*tài guò* 太过), yet the **Wood** (*mù* 木) **qi** (*qì* 氣) takes advantage of its weakness and overcomes the Earth, then the **Metal** (*jīn* 金) **qi** follows and again overcomes it—this is the reversal of **evil transformations** (*xiéhuà* 邪化). If the overcoming is slight or does not recur, then in the following three years, the **epidemic** (*lì* 疠) will manifest, called **Earth epidemic** (*tǔ lì* 土疠), whose symptoms resemble those of **Earth epidemic** (*tǔ yì* 土疫). Its origin is from **Heaven’s** (*tiān* 天) **epidemic** (*lì* 疠), descending to Earth, hence the reversal of evil transformations.

Sometimes, it governs **in the Spring** (*zàiquán* 在泉).

chunks.original_text: 少阴壬至午年司天，应时而迁正得位者。 即下丁酉未得迁正者，即地下丙申少阳未得退位者，见丁壬不合德也。 即壬丙相对，午申相配，此失守非合德，见非太过也。 即丁柔干失刚，亦木运小虚也，有小胜小复。 阳明如至，即不复也。 后三年化疠，名曰木疠，其状如风疫，法治如前。 可大吐而治之。 假令戊申阳年太过，如丁未天数太过者，虽交得戊申年也。 虽戊临申，犹未迁正也。 太阴犹尚治天，地已迁正，厥阴在泉。 癸亥治地。 去岁壬戌，太阳以退位作右问，即天丁未，地癸亥，故地不奉天化也。 即厥阴当上奉少阳，故不与太阴奉合，故丁未与癸亥不相合。 丁癸相会，火运太虚，反受火胜，故非太过也，即夷则之管，上太征不应。 非戊癸相合也，故火运不应，其夷则未应其征也，下管癸亥，少征应之，即下见癸亥，主司地，故同声之不相应，即上下天地不相合德，故不相应也。 此戊癸失守其会，后三年化疫也，速至庚戌。 首尾三年。 大小善恶，推疫至之年天数及太一，又只如戊申，如戊至申，且应交司而治天。 少阳主戊申年司天，应时迁正而治天也。 即下癸亥未得迁正者，即地下壬戌，太阳未退位者，见戊癸未合德也。 即壬戊#10相对，申戌相配，此失守，非合德，又非太过。 即下癸柔干失刚，见火运小虚也，有小胜，或无复也。 厥阴至即无复。 后三年化疠，名曰火疠也。 治法如前，治之法可寒之泄之。 已上五失守变五疫，下五失守变五疠也。 即上刚柔二干共主运，有失支不守之者，以此五法，即诸阳年也。 黄帝日：人气不足，天气如虚，人神失守，神光不聚，邪鬼干人，致有夭亡，可得闻乎？ 人气与天气同失守，即鬼邪干人政死也。 岐伯日：人之五藏，一藏不足，又会天虚，感邪之至也。 其不足之藏，与天气同声虚也。 人忧愁思虑即伤心，又或遇少阴司天，天数不及，太阴作接问至，即谓天虚也，此即人气、天气同虚也。 又遇惊而夺精，汗出於心。 大惊汗出於心，即心中精脉喊少，故神失守心也。 因而三虚，神明失守。 先有劳神之病，又遇少阴天数不及也，又更惊而夺精，此三会而神明失守也。 心为君主之官，神明出焉。 心先有病，又遇天虚而感天重虚也。 心者，任治於物，故为君主之官。 清静柄灵，故日神明出焉。 神失守位，即神游上丹田，在帝太一帝君泥丸君下。 太一帝君，在头日泥九君，总众神，地#11君主之官，神明失守其位，游於此处，不守心位。 神既失守，神光不聚。 神光，即飞圆光也。 圆光不洁，即圆光缺矣，即鬼邪阴尸干人。 却遇火不及之岁，有黑尸鬼见之，令人暴亡。 其火运不及，非只癸年、戊年，失守亦然，火司天数不及亦然也。 黑尸鬼，形如黑犬，头似妇人发蓬不髻，目大，人见之，吸人神魂。 皆作大声，卒然而亡。 人饮食劳倦即伤脾。

**Shaoyin** (少阴) in the **Rénwǔ** (壬午) year governs Heaven in season, ascending to its proper position (*qiānzhèng* 迁正). Yet **Dingyǒu** (丁酉) below fails to ascend, and **Bingshēn** (丙申), **Shaoyang** (少阳) of Earth, does not retreat its position (*tuìwèi*). Thus, **Ding** (丁) and **Rén** (壬) do not harmonize their **virtues** (*dé* 德).

**Rén** (壬) and **Bing** (丙) oppose each other, while **Wǔ** (午) and **Shēn** (申) align—this is a failure of governance, not harmonization, and thus not an excess (*tài guò*). **Ding** (丁), soft and yielding, lacks firmness, so the **Wood** (*mù* 木) **qi** (*qì* 氣) is slightly depleted (*xiǎo xū* 小虚), with minor victory and minor reversal. When **Yangming** (阳明) arrives, there is no reversal.

In the following three years, **cātè** (疠) arises—named **Wood cātè** (*mù cātè* 木疠)—its form resembling wind plague (*fēngyì* 风疫). Treatment follows prior methods, with **great vomiting** (*dà tù* 大吐) as the remedy.

Suppose in a **Wùshēn** (戊申) **Yang** year of excess (*tài guò*), akin to **Dingwèi** (丁未) years of excess—even if the **Wùshēn** (戊申) year arrives—**Wù** (戊) has not yet ascended to its proper position. **Taiyin** (太阴) still governs Heaven, Earth has already ascended, and **Jiyin** (厥阴) is at the **Spring** (*quán* 泉). **Guǐhài** (癸亥) governs Earth.

Last year, **Rénxū** (壬戌), **Taiyang** (太阳) retreated its position as **right question** (*yòuwèn* 右问). Thus, Heaven was **Dingwèi** (丁未), Earth **Guǐhài** (癸亥), so Earth did not follow Heaven’s transformations (*huà* 化). **Jiyin** (厥阴) should govern above in conjunction with **Shaoyang** (少阳), yet it does not harmonize with **Taiyin** (太阴), so **Ding** (丁) and **Guǐ** (癸) do not harmonize their **virtues** (*dé* 德). When **Ding** (丁) and **Guǐ** (癸) meet, the **Fire** (*huǒ* 火) **qi** (*qì* 氣) is excessively depleted (*tàixū* 太虚), suffering reversal under **Fire** victory (*shèng* 胜), hence not being excessive (*tài guò*). This is the **Yízhé** (夷则) **pipe**, where the **upper Great Zheng** (*shàng tài zhēng* 上太征) does not respond. Since **Wù** (戊) and **Guǐ** (癸) do not harmonize, the **Fire** **qi** (*qì* 氣) does not respond, and the **Yízhé** **pipe** does not answer its **Zheng** (*zhēng* 征). Below, the **Guǐhài** (癸亥) **pipe** responds to the **minor Zheng** (*xiǎo zhēng* 少征), for **Guǐhài** (癸亥) governs Earth. Thus, the **same-sounding** (*tóngshēng* 同声) does not respond, and Heaven and Earth above and below do not harmonize their **virtues** (*dé* 德), hence no response.

This is **Wù** (戊) and **Guǐ** (癸) failing to govern their meeting, and in three years, **plague** (*yì* 疫) arises, arriving swiftly by **Gēngxū** (庚戌)—three years in total. Its severity—great or small, benevolent or malevolent—is determined by the **Heavenly Stem** (*tiānshù* 天数) of the plague’s arrival and the **Taiyi** (太一). Again, as with **Wùshēn** (戊申), when **Wù** (戊) arrives at **Shēn** (申), it should govern Heaven in season, ascending to its proper position.

Below, **Guǐhài** (癸亥) has not ascended, and **Rénxū** (壬戌), **Taiyang** (太阳), has not retreated its position. Thus, **Wù** (戊) and **Guǐ** (癸) do not harmonize their **virtues** (*dé* 德). **Rén** (壬) and **Wù** (戊) oppose each other, while **Shēn** (申) and **Xū** (戌) align—this is a failure of governance, not harmonization, nor excess. Below, **Guǐ** (癸), soft and yielding, lacks firmness, so the **Fire** **qi** (*qì* 氣) is slightly depleted (*xiǎo xū* 小虚), with minor victory and possibly no reversal. When **Jiyin** (厥阴) arrives, there is no reversal.

In the following three years, **cātè** (疠) arises—named **Fire cātè** (*huǒ cātè* 火疠). Treatment follows prior methods: **cooling** (*lǎn* 寒) and **draining** (*xiè* 泄).

The above five failures of governance bring five plagues; the below five failures bring five **cātè** (疠). When both **Yang** (*gāng* 刚) and **Yin** (*róu* 柔) **Stems** jointly govern the **qi** (*qì* 氣) cycle, yet a **Branch** (*zhī* 支) fails to hold its position, these five methods apply—all in **Yang** years.

**Huángdì** (黄帝) asked: *"When human **qi** (*qì* 氣) is insufficient, Heaven’s **qi** is like a void, and human **spirit** (*shén* 神) loses governance, the **spirit-light** (*shēnguāng* 神光) does not gather—evil spirits assail the person, leading to untimely death. May this be heard?"*

*"When human **qi** (*qì* 氣) and Heaven’s **qi** both lose governance, evil spirits assail the person, causing death."*

**Qíbó** (岐伯) replied: *"The five **viscera** (*zàng* 藏) of a person—if one is insufficient and encounters Heaven’s void, it is susceptible to **evil influences** (*xié* 邪). The deficient **viscus** resonates with Heaven’s void **qi** (*qì* 氣).*

*When a person is anxious, overthinks, or is troubled, the **Heart** is injured. If this occurs while **Shaoyin** (少阴) governs Heaven and Heaven’s **Stem** (*shù* 数) is insufficient, and **Taiyin** (太阴) arrives as **right question** (*yòuwèn* 右问), this is called **Heaven’s void** (*tiān xū* 天虚)—thus, human **qi** and Heaven’s **qi** are both void.*

*Again, if startled and **jing** (*jīng* 精) is depleted, sweat emerges from the **Heart**. Great startlement causes sweat from the **Heart**, depleting the **Heart’s** **vessel-pulse** (*mài* 脉), so the **spirit** (*shén* 神) loses governance of the **Heart**. Thus, the three voids—**Heart**, **spirit**, and **light**—cause the **spirit** (*shén* 神) to lose governance.*

*First, there is a disease of **spirit-labor** (*láoshén* 劳神), and then encountering **Shaoyin** (少阴) with insufficient Heavenly **Stem** (*shù* 数), further startled and **jing** (*jīng* 精) depleted—these three convergences cause the **spirit** (*shén* 神) to lose governance.*

*The **Heart** is the sovereign’s **viscus**, from which **spirit** (*shén* 神) and **clarity** (*míng* 明) emerge. If the **Heart** first has disease, and then encounters Heaven’s void, it is further burdened by Heaven’s excess void. The **Heart**, entrusted to govern all things, is thus the sovereign’s **viscus**. In **clarity** and **stillness**, it holds **spirit** (*shén* 神), hence it is said that **spirit** (*shén* 神) and **clarity** (*míng* 明) emerge from it.*

*When the **spirit** (*shén* 神) loses governance, it wanders to the **upper elixir field** (*dāntián* 丹田), beneath **Taiyi** (太一) **Emperor** (*Dìjūn* 帝君) and **Níwán** (泥丸) **Lord** (*Jūn* 君). The **Taiyi** (太一) **Emperor** (*Dìjūn* 帝君), in the head, is the **Níjiǔ** (泥九) **Lord**, commanding all **spirits** (*shén* 神). The **Earth** (*dì* 地) **Lord** (*Jūn* 君) is the sovereign’s **viscus**; when the **spirit** (*shén* 神) loses its position, it wanders here, not guarding the **Heart**.*

*The **spirit** (*shén* 神) having lost governance, the **spirit-light** (*shēnguāng* 神光) does not gather. The **spirit-light** is the **flying round light** (*fēiyuán guāng* 飞圆光). If the round light is impure, it becomes deficient, and **evil spirits**, **Yin corpses** (*yīn shī* 阴尸), and **ghosts** (*guǐ* 鬼) assail the person. If this occurs in a year when **Fire** is insufficient, **black corpse ghosts** (*hēi shī guǐ* 黑尸鬼) appear, causing sudden death. The **Fire** **qi** (*qì* 氣) being insufficient is not only in **Guǐ** (癸) or **Wù** (戊) years—failure of governance likewise, nor is it only when **Fire** governs Heaven insufficiently.*

*The **black corpse ghost** (*hēi shī guǐ* 黑尸鬼) resembles a black dog, with a woman’s head—hair disheveled, unbound, eyes large. When seen by people, it drains their **spirit** (*shén* 神) and **soul** (*hún* 魂). It emits a great cry, and the person suddenly dies.*

*Excessive **drinking**, **eating**, **labor**, and **fatigue** injure the **Spleen** (*pí* 脾).*

chunks.original_text: 即饮食饱举房事，即气滞於脾，以劳疫气满问，脾藏有病也。 又或遇太阴司天，天数不及，即少阳作接问至，即谓之虚也。 人气与天气不及，即感天人气虚，及又虚也。 此即人气虚而天气虚也，又遇饮食饱甚，汗出於胃，醉饱行房，汗出於脾。 脾胃汗出，即精血喊少，感天虚而作三虚，脾神失守其位。 因而三虚，脾神失守。 先有病於脾，次遇天虚，脾感天重虚，又遇汗出而喊其精血，乃故名三虚也。 脾为谏议之官，智周出焉。 脾者心之子，心有所忆谓之意，意中所出谓之智，智周万物谓之神，即脾胃神意智，乃故失守其位者也。 神既失守，神光失位而不聚也。 神光不聚，鬼乃干之。 却遇土不及之年，或己年或甲年失守，或太阴天虚，青尸鬼见之，令人卒亡。 人久坐湿地，强力入水，即伤肾。 汗出於肾，即精血喊少，故作三虚。 即精亡，心神失守其位也。 肾为作强之官，仗巧出焉。 因而三虚，肾神失守，神志失位，神光不聚。 神、精、志三神虚失位，游於黄庭司命君之下，乃即圆光缺矣。 却遇木不及之年，或辛不会符，或丙年失守，或太阳司天虚，有黄尸鬼至，见之令人暴亡。 有此三虚，又遇水不及，即黄尸鬼干人，牛头身黄，见之时，吸人神魂，皆暴亡也。 人或患怒气逆，上而不下，即伤肝也，又遇厥阴司天，天数不及，即少阴作接问至，是谓天虚也。 肝先病，又遇天虚而感重虚也。 此谓天虚人虚也，又遇疾走恐惧，汗出於肝，肝为将军之官，谋虑出焉，神位失守，神光不聚。 神光不聚，即圆光缺而不周，尸鬼乃干人也。 又遇木不及年，或丁年不符，或壬年失守，或厥阴司天虚也，有白尸鬼见之，令人暴亡也。 有此三虚者，即神游失守，白尸鬼干人，头如鹞身白，有白毛，见之吸人神魂，皆卒然而亡也。 已上五失守者，天虚而人虚也，神游失守其位，即有五尸鬼干人，令人暴亡也，谓之曰尸厥。 但卒然而亡，口中无涎者，舌卵卵缩者，尸厥若出涎而舌卵者，盛厥也。 人犯五神易位，即神光不圆也，非但尸鬼，即一切邪犯者，皆是神失守位故也。 神失守位，虽其体中而二气失位也，即神光不聚而邪犯之，有妖魅交通往来，皆是五神失守，乃邪所至也。 此谓得守者生，失守者死。 得守者，本位而五神各得其居，即神光乃圆明而聚矣，故一切邪不犯之乃生也。 得神者昌，失神者亡。 老子云：气来入身谓之生，神去於身谓之死。 故日命由神生，命生神在，即命生神去，即命夭矣。 所谓神游失守，即不离身，故不可便死也，其主管在头上，三尊高位灵主言也，即太一帝君在头，日泥丸，总神也，无英君左制三魂也，白元君右拘七魄也，即魂为阳神也，魄为阴鬼也，若无上三虚主之，神离位者死。 今五神失守，亦有主归，即神光不聚，圆光亦缺，故邪干犯之。 若神失守其位，即知人生神昌。 黄帝内经素问遗篇卷之五 #1嗽：原作『软』，据元刻本改。 #2溢：疑当作『嗑』。 #3下：疑当作『数』。 #4下：疑当作『数』。 #5其：此下元刻本有『复』字。 #6二：明刻本作『干』。 #7云：明刻本作『去』。 #8灭：原作『威』，据文义改。 #9二：元刻本作『三』。 #10戊：元刻本作『戌』。

When one overindulges in drinking, eating, and sexual activity, the **Spleen** (*pí* 脾) **qi** stagnates, and when labor and pestilential **qi** converge, the **Spleen**’s stored essence falls ill. Again, if one encounters a year when **Taiyin** (太阴) governs Heaven insufficiently, the **Shaoyang** (少阳) **qi** rises to compensate, which is called **emptiness** (*xū* 虚). When a person’s **qi** and Heaven’s **qi** are both insufficient, they are struck by the **emptiness** of Heaven and man, and by **double emptiness**.

This is when a person’s **qi** is empty and Heaven’s **qi** is empty, and if they further overindulge in food and drink, sweat emerges from the **Stomach** (*wèi* 胃). If they are drunk and gluttonous and engage in sexual activity, sweat emerges from the **Spleen**. When the **Spleen** and **Stomach** sweat, **essence** and **blood** are depleted, and they are struck by Heaven’s **emptiness**, forming **triple emptiness** (*sān xū* 三虚). The **Spleen’s spirit** (*shén* 神) loses its post.

Thus, **triple emptiness** arises, and the **Spleen’s spirit** loses its post. First, there is illness in the **Spleen**; then, encountering Heaven’s **emptiness**, the **Spleen** is struck by **double emptiness**. If sweat emerges and depletes **essence** and **blood**, this is called **triple emptiness**. The **Spleen** is the **Censor-in-Chief** (*jiànyì zhī guān* 谏议之官), from which wisdom emanates. The **Spleen** is the **Heart’s** (*xīn* 心) child; when the **Heart** remembers, it is called **intent** (*yì* 意). What emerges from intent is called **wisdom** (*zhì* 智). When wisdom encompasses all things, it is called **spirit** (*shén* 神). Thus, the **Spleen’s** spirit, intent, and wisdom lose their post.

When the spirit loses its post, the **spiritual radiance** (*shén guāng* 神光) shifts and does not gather. When the **spiritual radiance** does not gather, **ghosts** and **evil spirits** assail them. If this occurs in a year when **Earth** is insufficient—whether in **Jǐ** (己) or **Jiǎ** (甲) years, or when **Taiyin** governs Heaven insufficiently—**green corpse ghosts** (*qīng shī guǐ* 青尸鬼) appear, causing sudden death. If one sits long in damp places or forcibly enters water, the **Kidneys** (*shèn* 肾) are injured. When sweat emerges from the **Kidneys**, **essence** and **blood** are depleted, thus forming **triple emptiness**. When **essence** is lost, the **Heart’s spirit** loses its post.

The **Kidneys** are the **Minister of Strength** (*zuòqiáng zhī guān* 作强之官), from which ingenuity emanates. Thus, **triple emptiness** arises, and the **Kidney’s spirit** loses its post, with **spirit** and **will** (*shí* 志) shifting. The **spirit**, **essence**, and **will**—the three **spirits**—become empty and shift, wandering beneath the **Yellow Court** (*Huángtíng* 黄庭) where the **Lord of Destiny** (*Sìmìng Jūn* 司命君) presides. Thus, the **circular radiance** (*yuán guāng* 圆光) becomes deficient. If this occurs in a year when **Wood** is insufficient—whether in **Xīn** (辛) years lacking correspondence, **Bǐng** (丙) years, or when **Taiyang** (太阳) governs Heaven insufficiently—**yellow corpse ghosts** (*huáng shī guǐ* 黄尸鬼) arrive, and seeing them causes sudden death. If **triple emptiness** persists and **Water** is insufficient, **yellow corpse ghosts** assail them, with cow-like heads and yellow bodies. Seeing them drains one’s **spirit** and **soul**, causing sudden death.

If one suffers from **anger** rising and not descending, the **Liver** (*gān* 肝) is injured. If this occurs while **Juéyin** (厥阴) governs Heaven insufficiently, **Shaoyin** (少阴) **qi** rises to compensate, which is called **Heaven’s emptiness**. The **Liver** first falls ill, then is struck by **double emptiness** from Heaven. This is called **Heaven’s emptiness** and **man’s emptiness**. If they further engage in hasty movement or fear, sweat emerges from the **Liver**. The **Liver** is the **General** (*jiāngjūn zhī guān* 将军之官), from which planning and deliberation emanate. The **spirit’s** post is lost, and the **spiritual radiance** does not gather. When the **spiritual radiance** does not gather, the **circular radiance** becomes deficient and incomplete, and **corpse ghosts** assail them. If this occurs in a year when **Wood** is insufficient—whether in **Dīng** (丁) years lacking correspondence, **Rén** (壬) years, or when **Juéyin** governs Heaven insufficiently—**white corpse ghosts** (*bái shī guǐ* 白尸鬼) appear, causing sudden death.

For those with **triple emptiness**, the **spirit** wanders and loses its post. **White corpse ghosts** assail them, with hawk-like heads and white bodies, white hair. Seeing them drains one’s **spirit** and **soul**, causing sudden death.

The above five cases of losing one’s post are when **Heaven’s emptiness** and **man’s emptiness** coincide, with the **spirit** wandering and losing its post, and the five **corpse ghosts** assailing them, causing sudden death—this is called **corpse syncope** (*shī jué* 尸厥). If one suddenly dies without drooling, with a retracted tongue like a coiled egg, or if **corpse syncope** occurs with drooling and a retracted tongue, this is **severe syncope**.

If one violates the **Five Spirits’** (*wǔ shén* 五神) proper positions, the **spiritual radiance** becomes incomplete. It is not only **corpse ghosts**—all manner of **evil spirits** assail them because the **spirit** has lost its post. When the **spirit** loses its post, even within the body, the **Two Qi** (*èr qì* 二气) lose their positions, and the **spiritual radiance** does not gather, allowing **evil spirits** to assail them. If **demons** and **spirits** communicate and pass through, it is because the **Five Spirits** have lost their posts, and **evil** has arrived.

This is why those who **guard** (*shǒu* 守) live, and those who lose their post die. Those who **guard** maintain their original positions, with the **Five Spirits** each occupying their proper abode. Thus, the **spiritual radiance** becomes bright and gathers, and all **evil spirits** do not assail them—they live. Those who **obtain the spirit** prosper; those who lose the **spirit** perish.

As **Laozi** says: *"When **qi** enters the body, it is called life; when the **spirit** departs the body, it is called death."* Thus, life arises from the **spirit**; when the **spirit** is present, life is sustained. When the **spirit** departs, life is cut short. What is called the **spirit** wandering and losing its post does not immediately mean death, for its overseer resides in the head—the **Three Sovereigns** (*sān zūn* 三尊) of high position and **Spiritual Lords** (*líng zhǔ* 灵主) speak of it. The **Supreme One Emperor** (*Tài Yī Dìjūn* 太一帝君) is in the head, at the **Néihuán** (*泥丸*), governing the **spirit**. The **Lord Without Rival** (*Wúyīng Jūn* 无英君) on the left restrains the **Three Souls** (*sān hún* 三魂), and the **White Primordial Lord** (*Bái Yuán Jūn* 白元君) on the right confines the **Seven Spirits** (*qī pò* 七魄). The **Souls** are the **Yang Spirit** (*yáng shén* 阳神), and the **Spirits** are **Yin Ghosts** (*yīn guǐ* 阴鬼). If the **Three Sovereigns** above do not oversee them, the **spirit** departing its post leads to death.

Now, when the **Five Spirits** lose their posts, they also have their overseers. When the **spiritual radiance** does not gather and the **circular radiance** becomes deficient, **evil spirits** assail them. If the **spirit** loses its post, one knows whether a person’s **spirit** prospers or perishes.
